channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Reformed cat burglar Sid hopes to raise funds with help from his family and their jewellery, Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou gets the fright of his life when he test-drives a superbike at Brands Hatch race track, and new employee Kristen faces a challenge when she has to value two huge tanzanite stones. Office manager Jo visits Maggie, a client who can't pay back her loan following a string of bad luck. She's in danger of losing her late mother's jewellery - unless Jo can talk round shrewd businessman James.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou's manoeuvring skills are put to the test as he drives a client's 40ft motorhome, and the Prestige Pawnbrokers boss also jets off to Marbella, Spain, with gem expert Kristen to value some precious jewellery. A self-confessed shopaholic hopes to sell two modern art paintings to pursue a new career in photography, while a woman decides to get rid of some of her designer handbags to raise cash for her hair extensions business.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps firefighter James find a two-bedroom Victorian conversion in south-west London on an £180,000 budget. In the same location, Phil Spencer looks for a spacious property suitable for Steve and Eloise and their baby twin daughters, but needs to persuade the pair to compromise on the area if they are to find anything within their £330,000 limit.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Miners Arms in Nenthead, Cumbria, where sisters Alison Baker and Lynda Clark hope to impress guests with their eco credentials.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Laetitia Kotsiopoulos hosts the first dinner party in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, where she hopes an evening of French gastronomy and a menu that includes snails, veal and a traditional cheese course will impress her guests and win her the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eva Philippou hosts the second night in Birmingham's Sutton Coldfield district, where she tries to impress her guests with a Greek feast, and hopes that dancing as her choice of entertainment will see her leading the field. However, rivals Laetitia and Sharon remain confident about their chances.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the Birmingham suburb of Sutton Coldfield, publican Randy Johnson wants to prove that he can put on more than mediocre pub grub, and tries to impress his guests with a black-tie theme and some interesting culinary techniques - including cooking with bricks. He surprises Sharon when he reveals that he used to sing in musicals, while Eva accidentally spits out a pistachio nut during one of her laughing fits.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lettings agent Sharon Wozniak hosts the fourth party in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, and she hopes to impress her guests with a classic West Midlands curry - but some diners are unimpressed by her menu. However, she manages to get French foodie Laetitia Kotsiopoulos to admit her wine was a good choice, despite being made locally. Later, her fish dish does not go down well with another contestant, so she hopes her deconstructed Margarita cheesecake can improve her chances of winning the prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outspoken hairdresser Patrick McMurray hosts the final party in Sutton Coldfield, and prepares a scallop starter and a classic beef Wellington. His first course goes down well, but Sharon soon becomes bored with his constant showing off - and it remains to be seen whether his saucy entertainment will prove a hit with the female guests.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit camel-racing couple Joe and Rebecca Fossett, who had outgrown their Warwickshire home and were hoping to spend their £700,000 budget on a place near their existing house but with eight acres of land. The duo also check on the progress of Nick and Katrina who were searching for a property in Jersey, to find out whether they took a safe option or went for something out of the ordinary.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Cheshire couple Alison and Stephen Bulger find a holiday home in the charming town of Marseillan in the South of France for their £115,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for a Cambridgeshire home for Mary and David, who recently became parents for the first time. However, they are also challenged to find a house for the baby's maternal grandparents Edna and George, who have moved to the area to be close to their extended family.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. A 10-month-old labrador needs a hip replacement before it can begin training as a medical-alert dog to help its owner with her rare health condition. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The best and funniest moments from the recent series, including armchair TV reviews of Culinary Genius, Britain's Got Talent, Line of Duty, Cruising with Jane McDonald, University Challenge and First Dates. Plus, news reports featuring Diane Abbott, squirrels and young children gate-crashing a serious interview.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Divorcee Jane wants to find a suitable partner for her son Bobby, and also a new romantic interest for herself, while maths teacher Paul's love of logic and equations is lost on financial advisor Sophie. Barber Lee has suffered from nerves all of his life and can't believe his luck when he's matched with 24-year-old nurse Abigail, but he forgets her name and has an unfortunate accident in the toilets.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Proving the authenticity of internet videos, including a game of table tennis being played with kitchen knives and a sound system pumping out bass so loud it turns a car to jelly.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: The young TV viewers offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on First Dates, Nature's Weirdest Events and classic movie Dirty Dancing. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou jets off to Palma to investigate a yacht thought to be worth £150,000, while Prestige Pawnbrokers' memorabilia expert Lawrence values a guitar signed by Oasis. An impressive diamond bracelet gives new branch manager Alicja a chance to secure an international client and a vivacious prospective customer hopes the proceeds from the sale of a set of designer handbags might help get a new business venture off the ground.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Seven strangers attempt to accumulate as much money as possible. Dan continues to divide the group and Soraya struggles to cope with being silenced.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton heads to Chile to look into coloured crisps and find out how these rainbow snacks get their colour. Meanwhile, Jimmy Doherty travels to Spain to investigate one of the trendiest items on our shelves, avocados, and the rapidly rising demand for these fruits which is leading to alarming reports of a crime wave hitting growers.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Former model Cathy brings in her collection of designer bags and jewellery, hoping to secure a £50,000 loan to help her launch a lingerie business, while Prestige boss James Constantinou attracts unwanted attention when he goes for a spin in a client's Ferrari. A woman wants to pawn her grandfather's First World War medals to raise money for her mother's funeral, and an inventor decides to part with his precious watch.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wirth - the CEO of a California ski resort - goes undercover to learn more about his company's working practices as he prepares to merge an existing operation with a new acquisition.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brothers Andrew and James Widdas run the Rose and Crown in Edgworth, near Bolton, and hope to provide boutique on a budget, but veterans Alison and Lynda are quick to find fault.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Children's food educator Beth Stephens hosts the first dinner party in Lowestoft, Suffolk, where she plans to impress her guests - caravan site owner Ray, beauty therapist Polly, housing officer Jonalt and ASBO officer Rachel - with locally sourced seasonal food. However, she and Rachel gang up on Ray for most of the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Caravan park owner Ray hosts the second night in Lowestoft, where he hopes to win the £1,000 prize with a Spanish-themed evening, complete with a homemade tropical zone and an Ibiza-style club night in a barn - despite it being the middle of winter.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Luxury-loving beautician Polly hosts the third evening in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and is determined to prove she is more than just a pretty face. She opts for a fine-dining menu that stresses quality over quantity, and hopes her smart dress code will bring out the genteel side of her guests - but distractions soon emerge in the form of revelations about Ray once being a new romantic.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Albanian-born civil servant Jonalt hosts the fourth party of the competition in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and hopes his family recipes can impress his guests. He demonstrates a hidden talent that makes the diners laugh, and one contestant is left feeling the heat when Beth and Rachel unite.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final dinner party in Suffolk is hosted by anti-social behaviour officer Rachel, who hopes to win over her guests with an evening of comfort food and a few tricks up her sleeve. She hates to lose, but will need to curb her comments towards the other guests and let her dishes do the talking if she wants to be in with a chance of beating joint leaders Holly and Jonalt.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun

programme.title: Homes by the Sea

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The return of the programme following the emergency services, this time focusing on the work of the police, paramedics and fire service in Wiltshire. The first edition examines the rise in racially aggravated hate crimes, with the mother of a nine-year-old girl calling 999 to report that her daughter has been racially abused by two 11-year-olds while out playing. PC James Isaac arrests a 29-year-old man who targeted a 17-year-old white girl with text messages after coming across photos of her and her black boyfriend on Facebook.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

When she touches the sacred tree, she has a terrifying vision. Meanwhile, half-human, half-elf Wil's mother gives him the Elfstones, a family relic containing ancient magic - only for them to be stolen by Eretria, a wild human raised by thieves. Poppy Drayton, Austin Butler and Ivana Baquero star.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. This week, the Caddy family of Bristol trade places with the Williams family from Weston-super-Mare. The Caddys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a seven-bedroom home, while for the eight-strong Williams family, who are among the nation's poorest 10 per cent, the swap means leaving their rented three-bedroom house and enjoying a weekly budget of £1,700 instead of their usual £110.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Staffordshire, the agents chase up a £3,000 deposit owed by a landlord to his tenant, and officers in Birmingham try to recover £25,000 from a nightclub owner for unpaid solicitor fees. Meanwhile, agents Max and Paul are in Surrey as they attempt to collect more than £3,000 owed to a garage after a customer disputed the repairs made to his van.(n)

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Trust no one. Deceive everyone. When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris (Di Caprio -- The Departed, Blood Diamond) is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Tango & Cash
programme.desc: Ray Tango and Gabriel Cash are two of LA's finest cops who can't stand each other but when they're wrongfully imprisoned the pair must work together to clear their names and bring down the people responsible(n)

programme.title: The Jewel of the Nile
programme.desc: All-action sequel to Romancing the Stone, which finds adventurer Jack and romance writer Joan once again fighting like cat and dog. However, when Joan is imprisoned by a tyrannical dictator while travelling in Africa, Jack rushes to rescue her. Together, they cross northern Africa accompanied by Ralph, who has got his eyes set on another fabulous treasure(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: This satirical comedy starring Sandra Bullock as a political consultant gives viewers an inside look at the high-stakes, win-at-all-costs world of politics. Bullock stars as "Calamity" Jane Bodine, who is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival Pat Candy (Billy Bob Thornton), who is working on the opponent's campaign and is also looking for every opportunity to antagonize Jane. The film is loosely based on the 2005 documentary of the same name by Rachel Boynton. Directed by David Gordon Green (Pineapple Express, George Washington). Produced by Oscar-winners George Clooney and Grant Heslov(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A very funny remake of Ernst Lubitsch's classic 1942 black comedy about actors who turn spies in World War II Warsaw. A theatre troupe are unwittingly embroiled in the Polish Resistance via a young freedom fighter who is carrying on an affair with the leading lady(n)

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Seconds before the Earth is to be demolished by an alien construction crew, a man is swept off the planet by his friend who turns out to be an alien(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three students seek a notorious hacker in the Nevada desert, and end up imprisoned in a high-tech government-research facility(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens competes in track and field at the 1936 Games in Nazi Germany, despite the host country's attempts to turn the event into a celebration of national pride and Aryan supremacy(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp

Jake Gyllenhaal, Josh Brolin, Jason Clarke, and John Hawkes co-star. Directed by Baltasar Kormakur (2 Guns)(n)

programme.desc: LA journalist Steve Lopez begins writing a column about a mentally ill homeless man with a talent for playing the cello. Lopez tries to help improve his life, but finds his new friend's state of mind a stumbling block. Drama(n)

programme.title: Nine to Five
programme.desc: Three female employees of a "sexist, egotistical, lying, hypocritical bigot" find a way to turn the tables on him(n)

(S) (Includes RTÉ News and Weather followed by iWitness)(n)

Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: When a horrific murder rocks the peaceful community of Holcomb, Kansas, legendary writer Truman Capote is inspired to record the shocking true story in his novel IN COLD BLOOD. Capote--accompanied by fellow wordsmith Nell Harper Lee (TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD)--travels to the Midwest in search of answers, and ends up becoming emotionally involved with one of the killers as they await trial(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: The early years of legendary director and aviator Howard Hughes' career, from the late 1920s to the mid-1940s. His career spanned everything from oil, for which he cared little, to movies, casinos, and aviation - as he turned millions of dollars into billions(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout
programme.desc: Brutal, wisecracking action thriller in which a secret service agent turned private eye teams up with a former football star after the footballer's lover is murdered. When a tape recording links the murder to a corrupt senator and a criminal football manager, the new partners try to penetrate the blackmail and corruption eating at the heart of professional sport and nail the bad guys(n)

Meanwhile, the day of the Art Walk arrives, and a visiting artist catches Maryellen's eye. Drama, starring Andie MacDowell.(n)

programme.desc: Part two of three. A witness reveals that personal trainer Newman flew to Los Angeles on the night of the murder, leading the officers to believe they have the wrong man. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

Drama, starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis trace a robbery suspect to a militia group, but McCoy is strangely affected by the leader's devotion to his cause - and begins to receive death threats once the case comes to court. Award-winning police drama, starring Benjamin Bratt and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Detectives Munch and Falsone head for pastures new, travelling to New York to aid the investigation into the death of a teenage model, while McCoy has a fight on his hands with the attorney representing the victim's parents. programme.desc: The discovery of a dead marine intelligence officer in a motel room sets the team off on a hunt for her killer. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

The team investigates with the help of Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A naval technology scientist is being rushed to hospital with a gunshot wound, only for an unknown assailant to stop the ambulance and finish the job there and then, while also killing everyone else on board. The investigation takes an intriguing turn when the post-mortem reveals an object was removed from the victim's chest, and even more so when an unlikely link emerges between the dead man and a surfer, giving Deeks and Kensi the chance to pull on their wetsuits and head down to the beach. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Sin City author Frank Miller's sweeping take on the historic Battle of Thermopylae comes to the screen courtesy of Dawn of the Dead director Zack Snyder. Gerard Butler stars as Spartan King Leonidas and Lena Headey plays Queen Gorgo. The massive army of the Persian Empire is sweeping across the globe, crushing every force that dares stand in its path. When a Persian envoy arrives in Sparta offering King Leonidas power over all of Greece if he will only bow to the will of the all powerful Xerxes (Rodrigo Santoro), the strong-willed leader assembles a small army comprised of his empire's best fighters and marches off to battle. Though they have virtually no hope of defeating Xerxes' intimidating battalion, Leonidas' men soldier on, intent on letting it be known they will bow to no man but their king. Meanwhile, back in Sparta, the loyal Queen Gorgo attempts to convince both the skeptical council and the devious Theron (Dominic West) to send more troops despite the fact that many view Leonidas' unsanctioned war march as a serious transgression. As Xerxes' fearsome "immortals" draw near, a few noble Greeks vow to assist the Spartans on the battlefield. When King Leonidas and his 300 Spartan warriors fell to the overwhelming Persian army at the Battle of Thermopylae, the fearless actions of the noble fighters inspired all of Greece to stand up against their Persian enemy and wage the battle that would ultimately give birth to the modern concept of democracy(n)

programme.desc: A tale of romance, betrayal and power set in 1193 BC, Troy. The love-struck Prince of Troy has fallen for the Queen of Sparta, angering the king, whose brother uses this love triangle against him in an effort to gain more power(n)

Sin City author Frank Miller's sweeping take on the historic Battle of Thermopylae comes to the screen courtesy of Dawn of the Dead director Zack Snyder. Gerard Butler stars as Spartan King Leonidas and Lena Headey plays Queen Gorgo. The massive army of the Persian Empire is sweeping across the globe, crushing every force that dares stand in its path. When a Persian envoy arrives in Sparta offering King Leonidas power over all of Greece if he will only bow to the will of the all powerful Xerxes (Rodrigo Santoro), the strong-willed leader assembles a small army comprised of his empire's best fighters and marches off to battle. Though they have virtually no hope of defeating Xerxes' intimidating battalion, Leonidas' men soldier on, intent on letting it be known they will bow to no man but their king. Meanwhile, back in Sparta, the loyal Queen Gorgo attempts to convince both the skeptical council and the devious Theron (Dominic West) to send more troops despite the fact that many view Leonidas' unsanctioned war march as a serious transgression. As Xerxes' fearsome "immortals" draw near, a few noble Greeks vow to assist the Spartans on the battlefield. When King Leonidas and his 300 Spartan warriors fell to the overwhelming Persian army at the Battle of Thermopylae, the fearless actions of the noble fighters inspired all of Greece to stand up against their Persian enemy and wage the battle that would ultimately give birth to the modern concept of democracy(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Bruce Willis returns once again as John McClane, the wisecracking, old-school New York cop whose impressive CV includes rescuing hostages captured in a swanky LA plaza and saving passengers on a hijacked plane circling Washington. In this violent thriller, he's up against a group of terrorists threatening to hack into the US computer infrastructure. When they crash the stock market, sending the economy into meltdown and causing panic on Wall Street, McClane turns to young hacker Matt Farrell. Farrell's wanted by the FBI, but he's also potentially the only man who can help figure out the cyber criminals' next move. When the terrorists respond by kidnapping McClane's daughter Lucy, it's time for the anxious father to load up his ammo clips and go get the bad guys - just as the country's descending into chaos(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: Matt Damon and Scott Bakula star in Steven Soderbergh's spy thriller The Informant, which tells the true story of a biochemist and an FBI agent who brought down a global price-fixing plan. Scott Burns adapts Kurt Eichenwald's book for Warner Independent Pictures(n)

programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: "Trainspotting" director Danny Boyle mines new veins of horror in this apocalyptic thriller about a deadly viral outbreak and the resilient Londoners trying to survive in a world of infected, flesh-eating zombies. Cillian Murphy, Naomie Harris, Brendan Gleeson, Christopher Eccleston, Noah Huntley(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris (Shailene Woodley) and Four (Theo James) lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind. Miles Teller, Ansel Elgort, Naomi Watts, and Zoë Kravitz reprise their roles in the third entry of this YA adventure series, while Jeff Daniels joins the cast. Directed by Robert Schwentke(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In this brutal survival tale based on a true story, 19th-century frontiersman Hugh Glass is betrayed and left for dead by his fur-trapping party after he is viciously attacked by a grizzly bear. However, Glass survives and sets out to seek revenge(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: In this hilarious and heartfelt rom com, four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Two friends set out on a journey of self-discovery, while a career gal struggles with settling down and an uptight romantic searches for her perfect match(n)

programme.title: Zoolander
programme.desc: Ben Stiller directs and stars in this satire on the fashion industry as the eponymous Zoolander, an air-head male model who's eclipsed by the equally vacuous Owen Wilson. But fashion designer Will Ferrell has plans for the ex-model - he's going to turn him into an international assassin!(n)

programme.desc: When a detective's fiancee is kidnapped by an ex-con, he must successfully complete 12 challenges in order to secure her safe release(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: CIA agent Jack Ryan races to avert war between Russia and the US after a terrorist threatens to detonate a nuclear bomb(n)

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Meet Fred Claus (Vince Vaughn), Santa¿s bitter older brother who is always getting into trouble. When he asks Nicholas (Paul Giamatti) for a loan to settle a debt, he is forced to move from Chicago to the North Pole to help with the Christmas rush in exchange. With Christmas fast approaching and an efficiency expert breathing down his neck, will he be able to work shoulder to shoulder with the elves without jeopardizing the Toy Shop finely tuned operation?(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: Musical drama set in 1928 that pays a visually striking tribute to the Prohibition era. Jazz musician Dixie Dwyer saves a gangster's life and gets sucked into the mobster's world of bootleg liquor, racketeering and escalating violence, centred round the eponymous Harlem nightclub(n)

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: Writer/director Steven Knight's Redemption stars Jason Statham as a British Special Forces veteran named Smith who has fallen on very hard times. He's an alcoholic homeless man huddling inside a box on a dingy London alley with a fellow homeless woman when a couple of criminals start harassing the junkies and the destitute. He reverts to his training, subdues the baddies, and makes a run for it, ending up in the home of a wealthy creative type who happens to be in New York for the next eight months. Smith movies in, cleans himself up, and gets a job as a toughman for a local Asian gangster. Haunted by horrific acts he committed while serving in Afghanistan, he spends much of the money he makes now to help fund a local soup kitchen run by Sister Cristina (Agata Buzek). When the woman he was with at the beginning of the movie turns up dead, Smith decides to hunt down the man responsible. Meanwhile, Cristina questions her own faith, confronts her haunted past, and makes Smith contemplate his own violent nature. Redemption is the feature directorial debut for Knight, who had previously scripted Eastern Promises and Dirty Pretty Things(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: A boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground during a family trip to the Grand Canyon in this skin-crawling tale of terror. He takes five sacred stones from there back home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Dylan, Natalie, and Alex are once again summoned to the office of their boss Charlie, where they're introduced to his new right-hand man Jimmy Bosley and given their latest assignment. It seems a pair of rings have gone missing and need to be recovered, but this was no ordinary jewel heist -- the rings have been coded with special information that can be used to access a list of every person in the FBI's Witness Protection Program, and when a handful of protected informants are murdered, the Angels are brought in to help crack the case(n)

programme.title: The Terminator

programme.desc: This direct-to-DVD sequel features Rob Lowe as an Iraq War veteran whose past comes back to haunt him in Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming. Upon returning home from the line of duty, National Guard Captain Ted Cogan thought his life would go back to normal, until he started seeing visions of a group of innocent bystanders he inadvertently killed in Iraq. With his family on the brink of destruction, Ted turns to a psychic that aids him in understanding what needs to be done to put these restless souls at peace - even if it means giving up his own life(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: In the wake of the detonation of a 'dirty bomb' in LA and under the instruction of a public service announcement, Brad barricades himself within his home. With his wife Lexi on her way to work, he desperately tries to call her in an attempt to find out if she is safe and well. As time elapses and his worse fear looks set to manifest, Lexi appears outside the family home..(n)

programme.title: Too Cute!

programme.desc: Crazy Cat Opens Doors. In the Season 8 premiere, a cat's aggressive behavior has a couple worried about their baby, and a cat with a wild side opens doors to get outside and hunt. Also: a "My Cat From Heaven" segment on a lifesaving feline in Ohio(n)

programme.desc: Saved From Misery. An investigator rescues a miniature horse from a neglectful owner; two abandoned dogs are captured(n)

programme.desc: Dr. Craig O'Connoll travels to the Bass Strait for sawsharks, while Victoria Elena Vasquez and Dr. David Ebert go into deep water in Tokyo Bay to find a goblin shark during Shark Week(n)

programme.desc: Four Blind Cats. A cycle of codependency threatens to get a woman and her cat kicked out of her parents' house; a bouncer needs lessons on how to handle his cat; a couple takes care of special needs cats(n)

programme.desc: In the Nick of Time. An out-of-control hoarder gets a visit from the Houston SPCA; two starving horses left to fend for themselves in a waterlogged paddock are rescued; an abandoned golden retriever suffers with a mysterious constant itch(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Houston
programme.desc: Rescued From the Brink. An investigator who finds two dead dogs and six starving beagles in a kennel searches for the person was responsible; a neglected horse with grossly deformed hooves leads to a nighttime arrest(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Breaking Point. Tia seeks an adoptive home for a pit bull with a unique appearance. Meanwhile, one of the parolees is slacking on the job, which angers the rest of the crew(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Mongolian Mauler. When he hears of an attack in a Mongolian river, Jeremy Wade wonders if it could be the work of a rare giant fish, said to be one of the world's strongest fighters on a line. But with illegal gold mining poisoning its last habitat, the species may already be extinct. Jeremy's quest leads him into a vast landlocked wilderness, peopled by gun-toting outlaws. Could any of these fish still survive in the rivers here?(n)

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Asian Slayer. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade continues his travels around the globe searching for fresh water monsters. Jeremy returns to the remote rivers of the Himalayas to investigate a spate of savage attacks. Jeremy thinks he knows the perpetrator's identity, but his plans to catch the monster hit trouble when the local people warn him that it is a sacred animal and he risks being cursed if he touches it. Never one to turn back, Jeremy pursues his quarry regardless - but as things start to go badly wrong, the hunt takes on an unnerving psychological dimension. Will his single-minded determination triumph over the gods, or will this one prove a beast too far?(n)

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle return to Longleat Safari Park as it enters its busiest time of the year, witnessing the giraffes making their way to their summer paddock.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in south Wales and the Scottish Borders, as well as a piece of land in Kent, meeting the new owners after the sales and tracking their progress as they aim to make money from their investments.(n)

programme.title: World War One Remembered: Passchendaele
programme.desc: Kirsty Young introduces live coverage of the centenary commemorations to mark the first day of the Battle of Passchendaele, from Tyne Cot cemetery in West Flanders, Belgium.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Fallon makes Bridget an offer, Conor tries to get through to Rachel about Brian and a report of a robbery leads to cash-strapped Vincent Kiely.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a Hampshire couple who are about to marry each other for the second time and are hoping to make a fresh start in Cornwall, with a budget of £700,000.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright reports on counterfeit and dangerous fuses being sold on the high street, and there is an investigation into the fake online reviews that ruined one boy's Christmas. Plus, a visit to the counterfeit capital of the UK as police launch a major crackdown.(n)

programme.title: Orkney: When the Boat Comes In
programme.desc: The small island chain off the north-eastern tip of Scotland will be visited by more than 120,000 passengers from cruise liners, and on its busiest days the capital Kirkwall will see its population of 7,000 almost double. As part of the Our Lives strand, this documentary focuses on the impact of these tourists on the lives of Orcadians, with their arrival bringing much-needed revenue but also a growing concern about the environmental impact and for Orkney's world famous Neolithic sites, including Skara Brae.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Carters struggle to get their heads around Fi's latest changes at the Vic, but that is the last thing on their minds when Whitney makes a surprise return. And what's more, she has some big news. Steven panics when Lauren forces him to go to the hospital, Max takes Carmel for a drink in the Vic and Bernadette is put out when she realises the Taylors cannot afford luxury items for her baby, so she comes up with an idea.(n)

programme.title: I Am Bolt
programme.desc: Documentary about the life and career of world-record breaking Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt, who has won the 100m and 200m gold medals at the last three Olympics. The film follows him as he prepares for the Rio 2016 Olympics and there is archive footage of his personal life and from his athletics career.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his career. There's a dead body down at the Phoenix Club, John and Kayleigh have an uninvited passenger, and Peter wows an audience of 15,000 with his shovel. Featuring an appearance by Queen. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Comedian and actor David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from October 2016, with Labour MP Chris Bryant and New Zealand comedian Rose Matafeo joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Adil Ray is the latest celebrity uncovering facts about his heritage in the genealogy documentary. The Citizen Kahn star's mother came to England from newly independent Kenya in 1967, and now he identifies himself as Muslim, Pakistani, African and Brummie. Adil heads to east Africa to find out more about his lineage, tracing his mixed Asian and African ancestry across Kenya to Uganda, meeting relatives for the first time in the traditional kingdom of Buganda and investigating a rumoured link to royalty.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At Longleat Safari Park, Kate Humble and Ben Fogle discover how a reluctant rhino is encouraged to take a mud bath, and cameras follow the arrival of lethal tarantulas.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a piece of land in Kent, a flat in London and a semi-detached property in Durham. They then speak to the buyers about how much they paid for them at auction, and what their plans are for the future.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Two siblings whose parents died in the Boxing Day tsunami of 2004 try to help two teenage brothers who lost their mum and brother. Aled Jones presents.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: After a contamination led to thousands having to boil their tap water, Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate how consumer supplies are kept clean.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A mother and son take on a mother and daughter at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh. Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the teams while Anita Manning leads proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Brian provokes Sharon, Bridget is tempted by an old flame, and a young man suffers the dark side of a loan shark. Drama, starring Sean Mahon and Jane McGrath.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple with a passion for dogs and horses seek a dream country home in Norfolk for £850,000, Sonali Shah tries to find them a property with enough land for their animals.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: The search for a Salford gang member leads the UK's National Crime Agency and detectives from Amsterdam to a small village in the Netherlands. And in Leeds, a grandmother with a history of dealing in amphetamines back home in Poland discovers West Yorkshire police have tracked her down.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Mick is stunned to learn Whitney's fiance is former Vic bar manager Woody - how will he react? Steven is relieved when Abi calls Lauren home from the hospital - only for Max to turn up, warning him he must tell Lauren the truth. Keanu surprises Bernadette with a present for the baby.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Newly appointed and keen to impress, Nina is intent on an innovative path and strikes a deal with a face from the past - but may yet come to regret it. Party animal Morven is determined to remain professional despite a number of obstacles, but then makes a regretful decision. When Sacha boasts about his new `lady friend', the team members are eager to meet her, but none are prepared for what unfolds on Keller ward.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: Helen finds herself in more danger as the investigation pulls her further into Manchester's criminal underworld. Paranoid, vulnerable but unperturbed, she tracks down the gang responsible for the shooting - before the case throws up some shocking revelations. And can Theo cheat death as the gang continues to be hunted by a mystery gunman? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is suspended after assaulting a high-ranking officer in the Met, suspecting him of covering up a death in custody years before. Meanwhile, an Argentinian pistol recovered from the Thames is linked to two unsolved murders which took place 16 years apart - and with one of them having occurred in Gibraltar, Sandra takes the team - minus Brian - on an Iberian adventure to uncover the truth. Alun Armstrong, Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star in the crime drama, with a guest appearance from Vincent Regan.(n)

programme.title: Orkney: When the Boat Comes In
programme.desc: The small island chain off the north-eastern tip of Scotland will be visited by more than 120,000 passengers from cruise liners, and on its busiest days the capital Kirkwall will see its population of 7,000 almost double. As part of the Our Lives strand, this documentary focuses on the impact of these tourists on the lives of Orcadians, with their arrival bringing much-needed revenue but also a growing concern about the environmental impact and for Orkney's world famous Neolithic sites, including Skara Brae.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Alex Jones talks to Brian Conley about her small-screen favourites, while reminiscing about her childhood. The One Show presenter re-enacts scenes from her favourite kids' show, reveals which popular comedian terrified her as a youngster and how a mix-up led to her big break. She also discusses her family's love of hidden-camera shows and how the family cat made the telly explode.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: Colin Stafford-Johnson and Lucy Cooke examine wildlife in cities, observing a seabird with a liking for high-rise living in Newcastle and the red fox's urban habits in Brighton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross hosts as two teams seek items of value at a wet and windy Newark antiques fair, hoping to profilt from their purchases later on at auction. Experts Charles Hanson and Phillip Serrell lend a hand with their buyng decisions.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence and Kev visit a second-hand car dealer who sold a vehicle with a dangerous flaw, and pay a visit to a technology company with a High Court writ. Ken Warby takes on one of the UK's biggest companies. But he has to find them first. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.sub-title: Triathlon World Series Highlights: 2017 ITU World Triathlon Series: Edmonton.
programme.desc: Action from the sixth round of the ITU World Triathlon Series in Edmonton, Canada, featuring the men's and women's races.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels to the Netherlands, where Nick Crane explores how Dutch engineers created massive coastal defences following the North Sea floods in 1953 that killed thousands of people. Historian Tessa Dunlop investigates why the tulip trade nearly bankrupted the country 400 years ago, Mark Horton discovers how a large area of coastal land was drained to create new living space, and Miranda Krestovnikoff finds out about raw herring becoming a popular seaside snack. Meanwhile, Countryfile's Adam Henson traces the history of the Friesian cow trade with Britain.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner travel to the Jurassic Coast of west Dorset, where Brian cooks up a lobster with garlic butter on the quayside. The duo then embark on a fossil hunt on the World Heritage site beach with geologist Paddy Howe, before chef Taher Jibet prepares a sea bream ceviche with locally grown wasabi. Portland Castle is the location for today's celebration cook - rib-eye of longhorn beef with duck fat potato wedges.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, focusing on dishes that all have something of a kick to them.(n)

programme.title: The Great Rift: Africa's Wild Heart
programme.desc: How geological forces created the Great Rift Valley in East Africa, and why a string of volcanos running from Ethiopia to Tanzania provides the ideal habitat for some of the world's most extraordinary wildlife. The programme also discovers many newly discovered species have made their homes among the dangerous peaks, where they have developed unorthodox methods of coping with the challenging terrain.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Samburu National Reserve's safari camp faces its busiest week yet, as wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton embarks on a mission to find newborn lion cubs. Meanwhile, her husband Frank Pope races to rescue a lioness in need of help. The pair's troubles are compounded when a power crisis strikes the camp, and one member of the team is rushed to hospital with what is suspected to be malaria.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an insight into the most successful animals on the planet. Observing an Arctic fox stalk prey in its -20C environment, he reveals warm-bloodedness as one of the key factors in the mammals' global domination. He also studies marsupials in Australia and Central America, offering a unique view inside a platypus's breeding burrow.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Kirby Hall in Northamptonshire, where members of the public bring along treasured antiques and collectibles to hear their stories and find out their worth. Items include a jade bowl once used as a butter dish, marine paintings from the family of Captain Bligh, a vintage TV set with a four-inch screen, a medieval ring found with the aid of a metal detector and a wind-up Charlie Chaplin doll. In the new feature looking back at previous items, art specialist Philip Mould hopes to learn more about a 500-year-old religious painting, originally featured in 2010 and now fully restored.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: World War One Remembered: Passchendaele
programme.sub-title: World War One Remembered: Passchendaele: Highlights.
programme.desc: Kirsty Young introduces highlights of the day's events to mark the centenary of the first day of the Battle of Passchendaele that took place earlier today at Tyne Cot cemetery in Belgium. VIPS, dignitaries and members of the Belgian and British militaries were joined by descendants of those who fought, to remember and pay tribute to the bravery and sacrifice of all those who served and died fighting.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the third of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Southampton pit their wits against a team from the University of Cardiff in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Former Great British Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain is in East Anglia as she continues her culinary road trip around Britain, going out to sea with Norfolk fisherman Richard Matthews to catch crabs for Vietnamese-style summer rolls. She then heads to Ely in Cambridgeshire to meet potato farmer and crisp factory owner Ross Taylor, using his snacks to make a crisp, chocolate and salted peanut dessert. Back in her kitchen, Nadiya creates a ploughman's cheese and pickle tart, and a herby chicken and potato salad.(n)

programme.title: Man in an Orange Shirt
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama by Patrick Gale about two love affairs 60 years apart - stories linked by family and a painting, with a secret that echoes down the generations. Captain Michael Berryman and Thomas March meet towards the end of the Second World War and enjoy a brief relationship in a secluded cottage when they return to Britain after the end of the conflict. Michael then goes back to London to his fiance Flora, while Thomas opts for the relative freedom of Soho. Starring James McArdle and Oliver Jackson-Cohen.(n)

programme.title: Normal for Norfolk
programme.desc: It's October at 17th-century manor house Wiveton Hall and pigeons are attacking the rape crop, the pigs are being prepared for their journey to the abattoir, and Desmond MacCarthy is trying to cajole his 101-year-old mother into buying him a new pair of binoculars for his impending 60th birthday. While Desmond does battle with the pests on his fields, his friends and family gather for birthday celebration complete with a meal of home-made cockerel korma with poppadoms. Narrated by Toby Jones.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace is at the world's largest dried pasta factory in Italy where they produce 150,000 kilometres of spaghetti each day. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey is discovering why the best pasta is made with durum wheat, and Ruth Goodman discovers that the product arrived in Britain much earlier than many would imagine.(n)

programme.title: A Prescription for Murder
programme.desc: With exclusive access to psychiatric reports, police footage and drug company data, reporter Shelley Jofre investigates the mass killings at the 2012 premiere of a Batman film in Aurora, Colorado. James Holmes, a 24-year-old PhD student with no record of violence, murdered 12 people and injured 70 others. Could the SSRI anti-depressants he had been prescribed play a part in the killings? This programme explores the devastating side effects of being prescribed SSRI anti-depressants, that might lead to psychosis, violence, and even mass murder.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: Dog owners and their pets compete in the final stage of the contest, taking place in the Lake District and hosted by Chris Packham. First, the Red and Yellow teams face a difficult canine intelligence test which involves Lake Windermere and some dog toys, with one pair proving just how far they have come. Then, the remaining competitors must take on a joint triathlon challenge, involving a two-kilometre bike ride, a 100 metre open water swim, and a 1.5 kilometre cross country run. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Joe Swash joins presenter Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that shaped him into a much-loved character actor. Vivid memories from his childhood recalled, courtesy of wacky character Grotbags. Joe then reveals which army drama was watched religiously in the Swash household, before touching on a docu-drama series that had the nation the edge of its seats.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle return to Longleat Safari Park as it enters its busiest time of the year, witnessing the giraffes making their way to their summer paddock.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning presents from Lewes, East Sussex, as experts Philip Serrell and Nick Hall help two teams to find three items to sell at auction.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chelsea gold medal-winners Dave and Harry Rich transform gardens around the country within the owners' budgets, beginning at a terraced home in York.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Josh Overington creates a fish stew made up of champagne, lobster, scallops and truffles, while Danny Parker creates a dish of scallop served with grapes and apple. And Tommy Banks uses turbot to create a meal inspired by the iconic Wimbledon food, strawberries and cream, but will which will impress the latest veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman presents this four-part documentary charting how the First World War affected the lives of the British people and created what is known as modern Britain. The first film focuses on the early stages of the conflict, the announcement of which led to stunned disbelief, followed by a mass recruitment drive as volunteers signed up to fight. With the fear of invasion gripping the country, even Boy Scouts were engaged to help guard bridges, and for the first time British civilians were bombed from the air and fired on by enemy ships. Jeremy hears from a 105-year-old eyewitness to one such attack - the shelling of Hartlepool in December 1914.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner explore North Yorkshire, beginning in the city of York, where Brian samples delicacies at a food shop. They enjoy a picnic on Sutton Bank hill, before Janet is given a private tour of Ampleforth Abbey's chapel and its antique furniture. The day's celebratory dish is roast porchetta with bread pudding and cider brandy glazed apples.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of economic recipes, including a Bake Off masterclass featuring Sussex suet pond pudding, and a James Martin tomato soup with garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: The Great Rift: Africa's Wild Heart
programme.desc: How the diverse array of waterways in East Africa's Great Rift Valley - including rivers, coral seas, caustic springs and waterfalls - helps to sustain the region's wildlife. A wide variety of birds, animals and fish rely on the water for survival, and many have evolved to adapt to the challenges posed by the area's geography.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Saba's guests are accidentally stranded at a remote airstrip in the scorching African sun, as the summer heats up, and the race is on to pick them up, while Saba prepares the camp for their arrival. Meanwhile, husband Frank puts himself on the frontline in the fight against ivory poachers.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough offers an insight into insect-eating animals, including shrews that dive under water, moles that can `swim' in the Namib Desert, and New Zealand bats that hunt in packs on the ground, walking on their wrists and foraging. Plus, how hedgehogs and armadillos liven up their diet with fruit and birds' eggs, while pangolins and giant anteaters survive entirely on a diet of insects.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Tredegar House near Newport in Wales, where members of the public bring along treasured antiques and collectibles. Items of interest include a tapestry woven in tribute to Status Quo, a carved coconut steeped in 18th-century maritime history and a frog-shaped brooch. A former Mastermind champion shows off the glass vase he won, and a Second World War veteran tells the story of a daring mission to inspect German defences before the D-Day landings - and how he came to have a packet of cigarettes from Field Marshal Rommel.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Sir Gareth Edwards at 70
programme.desc: Gabby Logan invites the rugby legend to reflect on his life and career with the help of a celebrity audience, performances and archive footage of his greatest moments. Gareth looks back on his achievements, from Welsh Grand Slams and British & Irish Lions triumphs to his prowess in World Superstars, which saw him compete against the greatest sportsmen on the planet. Guests paying tribute include Sian Phillips, Rob Brydon, Max Boyce, Sean Fitzpatrick, Matthew Rhys and Bryn Terfel, while there is also a surprise contribution from the Duke of Cambridge in his role as patron of the Welsh Rugby Union.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace investigates Europe's largest biscuit factory in London, while Cherry Healey looks into the chocolate added to the beloved digestive. Plus, Ruth Goodman examines the link between biscuits and digestion.(n)

programme.title: Is It Safe to Be Gay in the UK
programme.desc: With homophobic hate crime a daily occurrence and on the rise in the UK, this film takes a look at the issue, and tells the stories of the victims, their families and the police that deal with the attacks. To explore the ongoing issue, this film hears from a chorus of LGBT victims who recall their experiences, and discuss how they dealt with such unprovoked attacks, simply for being who they are.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: After recent revelations, Lance, Andy, Becky and Sophie are trying to come to terms with an uncertain future. Terry puts his emergency plan into action - but it will help only one of them. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Queer as Art
programme.desc: The BBC continues to mark the 50th anniversary of decriminalisation of male homosexuality in the UK with its Gay Britannia season. This time, the focus falls on the LGBT contribution to the arts scene in the past half-decade, as Stephen Fry, David Hockney, Anthony Sher, Alan Cumming, Will Young and Alan Hollinghurst share their perspectives on the distinctive voices the community has brought to British cultural life. Also includes contributions by Val McDermid, Wayne Sleep, Julie Goodyear, Sandi Toksvig, Russell T Davies and many more.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Writer Tom Cunliffe profiles ships that have played an important role in the development of modern Britain. He begins by taking a trip in the Matthew, the vessel that carried 15th-century explorer John Cabot 3,000 miles across the Atlantic to the North American continent.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dawn of the Driverless Car.
programme.desc: Exploring the artificial intelligence required to replace human drivers, focusing on issues including the ethics of driverless car crashes and the impact on jobs. Despite the glossy PR and positives such as reduced exhaust emissions, the reality is that the future of driverless cars might not be all good news.(n)

programme.title: Two Types: The Faces of Britain
programme.desc: Mark Ovenden tells the stories of Johnston and Gill Sans, the two modern typefaces that have come to be regarded as the `faces' of Britain.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: New series. In the first of eight short monologues written in response to the 50th anniversary of the decriminalisation of homosexuality, a young man returning from the trenches of the First World War recollects a love that he dare not speak about. Starring Ben Whishaw and written and directed by Mark Gatiss.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: It is 1994 and as Parliament votes on lowering the age of male homosexual consent, 17-year-old Andrew arrives in London for the first time - with unexpected results. Monologue by Michael Dennis, starring Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Created from a treasure trove of archive material, this documentary charts a century of gay experiences, encompassing persecution and prosecution, injustice, love and desire, identity, secrets, forbidden encounters, sexual liberation and pride. The soundtrack weaves the lyrics and music of John Grant, Goldfrapp and Hercules & Love Affair with the images.(n)

programme.title: Sex and Sensibility: The Allure of Art Nouveau
programme.desc: Stephen Smith presents a history of the early 20th-century art and design movement, beginning by exploring how it changed the face of Paris. He examines pieces of jewellery created by Rene Lalique, analyses Alphonse Mucha's posters of actress Sarah Bernhardt and visits locations that epitomise the art nouveau style, including Maxim's restaurant. He also discusses why creative thinkers including architect Hector Guimard and glass-maker Emile Galle believed their work could inspire social change.(n)

programme.title: Carved with Love: The Genius of British Woodwork
programme.desc: Documentary profiling influential figures in the world of wood craftsmanship. The first film focuses on famous furniture designer Thomas Chippendale, tracing his journey from humble roots working as a joiner in Otley, West Yorkshire, to his success as a cabinet-maker in London.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dawn of the Driverless Car.
programme.desc: Exploring the artificial intelligence required to replace human drivers, focusing on issues including the ethics of driverless car crashes and the impact on jobs. Despite the glossy PR and positives such as reduced exhaust emissions, the reality is that the future of driverless cars might not be all good news.(n)

programme.title: Two Types: The Faces of Britain
programme.desc: Mark Ovenden tells the stories of Johnston and Gill Sans, the two modern typefaces that have come to be regarded as the `faces' of Britain.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Writer Tom Cunliffe goes aboard the HMS Pickle to tell the remarkable story of the ship that took part in the Battle of Trafalgar in 1805 and was used to deliver the news of victory to the nation because its small size and revolutionary design made it faster than its bigger counterparts.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About
programme.sub-title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Tsunamis.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart explores the destructive power of the sea, examining the devastation that can be caused by underwater volcanic eruptions and sub-aqua tectonic activity. He also reveals wartime plans to harness tsunamis as weapons, and examines the story of two men who successfully surfed the tallest wave in history. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: Explorers: Conquest and Calamity - A Timewatch Guide.
programme.desc: Fara Dabhoiwala trawls five decades of the BBC archive to explore how documentary-makers have shifted their attitude toward explorers over the past five decades.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: It is 1987, and with Aids hitting the headlines, a new part looks like a game-changer for actor Phil. Monologue, starring Russell Tovey and written by Brian Fillis.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: Alice and her husband share a secret, though the publication of the Wolfenden Report in 1957 may change all that. Monologue, starring Rebecca Front, and written by Jon Bradfield.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Scott's Hut
programme.desc: Ben Fogle travels to Antarctica, where he joins a project hoping to preserve the hut from which explorer Captain Robert Scott launched his ill-fated polar expedition in 1911. The building, located on the remote Cape Evans, has remained practically untouched and contains thousands of items left behind by Scott and his team. The programme also features extracts from the explorer's diaries, read by Kenneth Branagh, as well as contributions by David Attenborough and Ranulph Fiennes.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: We revisit the first leg of the 1984 European Cup semi-finals as Dundee United, playing in their first and only top flight European campaign, took on Roma at Tannadice Park.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: We revisit the second leg of the 1983/84 European Cup second round as a star-studded Liverpool side faced Athletic Bilbao at the San Mames Stadium. A tight first leg finished 0-0.(n)

programme.title: Classics in Europe
programme.desc: With a 1-0 first leg deficit to overturn, a 38-year-old Alex Ferguson took his Aberdeen side to Anfield to face Liverpool in the second round of the 1980 European Cup.(n)

programme.desc: We revisit this thrilling third round second leg clash at Anfield between Bob Paisley's Liverpool and French champions Saint-Etienne, who led by a goal-to-nil from for first leg.(n)

programme.desc: After a mid-series break, the drama following the exploits of the Los Angeles-based Office of Special Projects returns. Sam and Callen investigate when five men wearing US Marine uniforms are found dead in a warehouse and discover they were killed by a lethal toxin that could be used as a bioweapon. Initial inquiries lead them to a former military chemist who now has Alzheimer's, while Callen recognises one of the victims as someone who used to work as hired muscle for the well-connected owner of a strip joint. Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J star.(n)
