programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will visits a gay TV station to give suggestions on policy, unaware Jack has just joined the company as an executive. Meanwhile, Grace is lured to an Alcoholics Anonymous meeting by the promise of free food - and bumps into Val. Guest starring Molly Shannon, with Eric McCormack and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Grace meets a new neighbour in the lift and invites him to a dinner party, but soon discovers he is not the ideal guest. Meanwhile, Jack falls out with his workmates, angry with them for teasing him about owning a Cher doll. Stephen Tobolowsky (Glee) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Enlisting for an American Civil War re-enactment allows Ray to spend time with his father, until he realises they will be fighting on opposite sides. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ally has to interview her oldest living relative as part of a school project on genealogy, so Ray helps her track down Frank's long-lost Aunt Sarina, who lives in Italy but turns up on the Barones' doorstep.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes an election broadcast on behalf of Seattle mayoral hopeful Holden Thorpe, prompting Frasier and Niles to throw their weight behind a rival candidate - who proves highly unsuitable for public office. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, with the guest voice of Sydney Pollack.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. While visiting the island of Bora Bora with new girlfriend Madeline, Frasier is unexpectedly reunited with his ex-wife Lilith. Comedy, guest starring JoBeth Williams and Bebe Neuwirth.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lilith's presence on Bora Bora causes Frasier to make a fool of himself, almost ruining his relationship with Madeline. Once back in Seattle, he tries to make amends. Starring Kelsey Grammer and Bebe Neuwirth.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: German businessmen buy the nuclear power plant from Mr Burns and make sweeping changes - starting by sacking Homer, whose laziness and ineptitude are at odds with their reputation for efficiency.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge visits the doctor, convinced she is pregnant again, leaving Homer behind to reminisce about the ups and downs of their life together since their marriage at Shotgun Pete's all-night wedding chapel.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Leeds compete to host the best dinner party, beginning with construction manager Martin and his wife Amanda, who are determined to win. They are rivalled by competitive engaged couple Amy and Nico who impress with their entertainment and Hannah and Nick, who try to prove their doubters wrong by cooking duck to order.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou jets off to Palma to investigate a yacht thought to be worth £150,000, while Prestige Pawnbrokers' memorabilia expert Lawrence values a guitar signed by Oasis. An impressive diamond bracelet gives new branch manager Alicja a chance to secure an international client and a vivacious prospective customer hopes the proceeds from the sale of a set of designer handbags might help get a new business venture off the ground.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with comedian Jenny Eclair joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: The new jurors are determined to stay positive and pull together to win up to £10,000, but when one outspoken member is silenced he is not happy at all.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies shows a number of properties to Robin and Susan Loxton from Suffolk, who want to buy a holiday home around the area of Mijas, their favourite part of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flight attendant Clint host the first dinner of four parties in Brighton, but he faces tough competition from care worker Ndana, food psychologist Sue and football fanatic Ed.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer starts his own web page and begins revealing the intimate secrets of everyone in Springfield - but ends up making powerful enemies who imprison him on an island. Featuring the voice of Patrick McGoohan.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Yasmine goes a step too far with Lily, while Harry turns to alcohol to heal his pain. Elsewhere, Misbah catches Kim and Farrah kissing and pleads with Kim to break up with her daughter, and Scott gets himself a job working with his secret brother, Damon.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Jacinta and Marco, who have outgrown their home in Didsbury, Greater Manchester, while Phil Spencer assists newly engaged Olivia and Amy, who want to settle back in the North after five years on the move.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: Public Enemies: Jay-Z vs Kanye
programme.desc: Documentary charting the rise to fame of the rappers and how their hopes and ambitions led to a falling out between them, featuring previously unseen footage and interviews with the people who know them best. The film tells the story of a creative partnership spanning two decades and reveals an even bigger story of how race, wealth and celebrity are shaping modern America.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
programme.desc: Hazing, drug use and violence envelop Clark County Jail as two of the eight participants find themselves on the brink of dropping out of the sheriff's programme.(n)

programme.title: Bear About the House: Living with My Supersized Pet
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the relationship between people and their exotic and potentially dangerous pets, including a seven-foot Russian bear who regularly has meals with his owners. Minnesota couple Mike and Valerie keep a one-ton buffalo that has to be showered in a car wash and goes on nights out to the local bar.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The founder and president of the Tilted Kilt Pub & Eatery chain of sports bars hopes to see how his staff operate by posing as a failed business owner taking part in a bogus reality TV show. Ron Lynch goes undercover to make sure his company's principles are being implemented by his corporate and kitchen staff alike.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two first-time buyers, beginning with Ian Harker, a vicar about to retire who wants to remain in east London with his wife. They then focus their efforts on businesswoman Shazia Awan, who has built a successful lingerie business and is looking forward to expanding her opportunities by moving from south Wales to London.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps three homeowners struggling to sell their properties in Newport, south Wales who are each given £1,000 to make improvements before hoping to impress buyer Amy, who is looking for a family home. Jo adds some 1950s glamour to her abode, while Rita and Sid tone down their decor, and Lynette changes her colour scheme and makes her house more memorable for potential buyers.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK

Jamie Theakston presents.(n)

In Scotland, Karen Ryrie and her elderly mother are fed up with living opposite John Tyer, his three dogs and a huge family of rabbits. Following their complaint about the smell, Karen's subsequent accusation of assault has made the dispute far more serious. Elsewhere, Linda Bird had not been expecting to wear headphones around the house when she moved to Bedfordshire for a quiet life, but the issue has escalated beyond excessive noise to become a battle over boundaries with neighbour Stanislav Fajdel.(n)

The bridge remained unfinished in Brunel's lifetime, but when he died in 1859, his friends decided that the bridge should be completed as a memorial, using the chains from another of his suspension bridges that was being demolished.(n)

programme.desc: Action from the Rally Finland, the ninth round of the season, which was based in Jyvaskyla in the Finnish Lakeland. A total of 25 stages were scheduled to take place at this event, mostly on gravel surfaces, and if the history of this rally is anything to go by then Finnish drivers would be expected to dominate proceedings.(n)

programme.desc: Mel Fisher rescues a young german shepherd after seeing footage of it being beaten by his owner, and brings the abuser to justice. Meanwhile, inspector Jacquie Miller has her hands full when three generations of dogs are signed over by their owner who is struggling to cope, and Alan checks on Ted, a spaniel rescued from a bedsit, who they hope can join the ranks of the police.(n)

programme.title: Make or Break
programme.desc: A look at the new partner-swapping couples' reality show in which eight couples put their relationships to the test by jetting off to a tropical Mexican resort. They are forced to swap partners every 48 hours, meaning the temptation to play away might prove too much for some.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: New series. As one door closes, another one opens. No sooner has Channel 5 crowned its latest Big Brother winner, it reopens the house to make way for a fresh batch of contestants - but this time, of course, the new reality residents are all famous faces. Cue a roll call of soap actors, reality stars and glamour models, with the odd Loose Women presenter and US star thrown in for good measure. As always, Emma Willis introduces each one as they enter, ready to have their every word and move recorded for the enjoyment of the viewing public. It's to be hoped BB fans don't have anything else planned for the next few weeks.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: New series. Rylan Clark-Neal presents the live spin-off show, inviting the audience and guests to comment on the new housemates and speculate on how they might get on together.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Controversial and often offensive stand-up comedian Andrew Dice Clay made his debut as a feature film star in this crude comedy. Fairlane is a "rock and roll detective" who works in the music business, has an office on Sunset Boulevard, and drives a 1957 Ford, with clothing to match. He floats through the rock clubs of Hollywood, picking up women and clients, and soon stumbles into a case involving the death of a heavy metal singer, a corrupt music executive (Wayne Newton), the murder of a radio shock-jock (Gilbert Gottfried), and the kidnapping of the jock's daughter (Maddie Corman). Music stars like Sheila E. and Motley Crue singer Vince Neil also have cameos in the film, which attempts to transplant Clay's aggressively obnoxious stage persona into a movie environment(n)

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: Madonna stars in husband Guy Ritchie's remake of this classic about a bored socialite who's stranded on an island with a rude and bullying sailor(n)

programme.title: Say Anything...

Within lies millions of dollars of illegal drugs, and the divers' dream of finding sunken treasure has come true. But as they argue among themselves about what to do with their prize, the friends soon realize they're not the only ones interested in the narcotics. Dangerous criminals are also searching for the drugs, and now the treasure hunters themselves have become the hunted(n)

programme.desc: A crew on-board a battered commercial space vessel, far away in space and time, encounter a deadly alien creature(n)

Now, with time running out they find themselves in a life-and-death race against the clock as the "perfect crime" begins spiraling towards an unthinkable, terrifying and deadly conclusion(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: Three people dealing with their own experience of the afterlife find their lives intertwining(n)

programme.desc: Rip-roaringly funny buddy comedy about a hapless chap who doesn't have any male friends to serve as best man at his wedding, until he meets a freewheeling fun-loving guy who just might fill the bill, but their chummy, male-bonding bro-mance just might impact the groom's relationship with his bride-to-be(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: Peter is a composer and a likable sad sack who's devastated when his girlfriend of five years, Sarah Marshall, the star of a cheesy CSI-style crime show, dumps him. He weeps, he rails, he mopes. Finally, his step-brother Brian suggests Hawaii, so Peter heads for a resort on Oahu where, as he's checking in, he sees Sarah and her new beau, Aldous, a polymorphously perverse English rocker(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: A bizarre experiment transforms a wise-cracking mercenary into a superpowered anti-hero(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Arthur and Norma Lewis receive a mysterious box that will grant them $1 million if they push the button inside, but they must debate if that's worth the consequence of killing a random person(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: John Moore's remake of the 1965 classic stars Dennis Quaid as a pilot who crash lands his passenger plane in the Gobi desert with no hope of rescue - unless they can scavenge enough parts to build a new plane(n)

programme.title: Never Die Alone
programme.desc: Rapper-turned-actor DMX is chilling in this intense account of the life and death of a violent drug kingpin. Flashbacks chronicle the life of King David (DMX), who turns out to be more like Goliath when he is knifed by a gangster's young henchman (Michael Ealy). David Arquette costars as an aspiring writer, who inherits audiotapes that detail all of King David's nasty business dealings. Clifton Powell(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Well-developed characters and rousing battle scenes buoy this epic high-seas adventure set at the height of the Napoleonic Wars. An English captain leads his warship, the HMS Surprise, in battle against a formidable French vessel(n)

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: In this action suspense thriller, nine-year-old autistic savant Simon deciphers a government code and calls in for his prize. Worried about national security, NSA officials send an assassin to kill him. His parents are killed but he is saved by an FBI agent who drags him through Chicago to protect him(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Harry Callahan or Dirty Harry is investigating a strange betting game. A list of local celebrities has been handed out, and bets are being taken on who will be the first to die(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Three men relive their carefree college years by killing off as many brain cells as possible in this hilarious comedy. Mitch (Luke Wilson) returns home from a less-than-pleasant business trip one evening to discover his wife, Heidi (Juliette Lewis), involved in a ménage à trois with two blindfolded strangers. Feeling less than welcome at home after this, Mitch rents a house near the campus of a nearby college; two of Mitch's old college buddies, Beanie (Vince Vaughn) and Frank (Will Ferrell). Starring Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn, Luke Wilson & Juliette Lewis(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Comedian Cedric the Entertainer serves as both producer and star of this comedy about a family who discovers just how much can go wrong en route to a family get-together. When Nate Johnson (Cedric the Entertainer) is invited to a big family reunion in Missouri, he sees it as an opportunity to reconnect with his estranged wife and growing children, as well as a chance to show up his wealthier know-it-all brother, Mack (Steve Harvey). Nate takes delivery on an expensive new SUV, persuades his recently separated wife, Dorothy (Vanessa L. Williams), to tag along, and packs up his three kids -- nubile teenager Nikki (Solange Knowles), under-age wannabe rapper D.J. (Bow Wow), and precocious seven-year-old Destiny (Gabby Soleil) -- for what he imagines will be a leisurely drive from Los Angeles to St. Louis. However, between his wary wife, arguing kids, angry police officers, bizarre hitchhikers, bad diner food, and an unfortunate run-in with a cement mixer, getting from point A to point B proves to be just short of a nightmare. Johnson Family Vacation was the first feature film for director Christopher Erskin, who previously distinguished himself directing music videos for the likes of Missy Elliot, TLC, and Boyz II Men(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: Two Puerto Rican NYC cops (Luis Guzman and Edgar Garcia) are asked by a pair of French fashion designers (Alice Taglioni and Frederic Anscombre) to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag. Rosie Perez and Rosario Dawson co-star. Directed by Ian Edelman(n)

programme.title: Private Benjamin
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn stars in this comedy about a high society woman who joins the army after her newly married husband dies on their wedding night(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: Johnny Depp is real-life drug baron George Jung, who rose from peddling pot in the 70s to become Colombia's top cocaine connection in the US. With Penelope Cruz(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: John Travolta stars in this thriller as divorced husband and father Frank Morrison, a boat builder concerned about his son Danny (Matthew O'Leary), a troubled 11-year-old who has shown a tendency to lie since his parents broke up. When his ex-wife Susan (Teri Polo) announces that she's getting remarried to Rick Barnes (Vince Vaughn), a recent arrival in town and a popular, wealthy philanthropist, Frank struggles with jealousy but feels that Rick might be a stabilizing influence for his son. When Danny begins relating unsettling stories about Rick, Frank at first chalks it up to youthful rebellion, but when Danny stridently claims to have witnessed his new stepfather committing murder, Frank's instincts tell him the story is true. As he investigates the new man in his family's life, Frank uncovers alarming facts about Rick, who's not the man he appears to be. Domestic Disturbance (2001) made headlines six months before its release when co-star Steve Buscemi, accompanied by Vaughn and screenwriter Scott Rosenberg, was stabbed and seriously injured in an after-hours bar brawl with locals near the film's North Carolina set(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve a New York cop goes to Los Angeles to visit his estranged wife at her company's Christmas party, held on the top floor of a huge skyscraper. The building is invaded by terrorists, leaving the cop, who's escaped to the roof, as the other partygoers' only hope for survival(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Controversial and often offensive stand-up comedian Andrew Dice Clay made his debut as a feature film star in this crude comedy. Fairlane is a "rock and roll detective" who works in the music business, has an office on Sunset Boulevard, and drives a 1957 Ford, with clothing to match. He floats through the rock clubs of Hollywood, picking up women and clients, and soon stumbles into a case involving the death of a heavy metal singer, a corrupt music executive (Wayne Newton), the murder of a radio shock-jock (Gilbert Gottfried), and the kidnapping of the jock's daughter (Maddie Corman). Music stars like Sheila E. and Motley Crue singer Vince Neil also have cameos in the film, which attempts to transplant Clay's aggressively obnoxious stage persona into a movie environment(n)

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: Madonna stars in husband Guy Ritchie's remake of this classic about a bored socialite who's stranded on an island with a rude and bullying sailor(n)

programme.title: Say Anything...
programme.desc: Romantic comedy in which a beautiful and brilliant high school student finds herself pursued romantically by a charming but totally unambitious fellow student(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: While treasure hunting in the Bahamas, a group of young divers discover a wrecked cargo plane on the ocean's floor. Within lies millions of dollars of illegal drugs, and the divers' dream of finding sunken treasure has come true. But as they argue among themselves about what to do with their prize, the friends soon realize they're not the only ones interested in the narcotics. Dangerous criminals are also searching for the drugs, and now the treasure hunters themselves have become the hunted(n)

programme.title: Alien: The Director's Cut
programme.desc: A crew on-board a battered commercial space vessel, far away in space and time, encounter a deadly alien creature(n)

Now, with time running out they find themselves in a life-and-death race against the clock as the "perfect crime" begins spiraling towards an unthinkable, terrifying and deadly conclusion(n)

programme.desc: Peter is a composer and a likable sad sack who's devastated when his girlfriend of five years, Sarah Marshall, the star of a cheesy CSI-style crime show, dumps him. He weeps, he rails, he mopes. Finally, his step-brother Brian suggests Hawaii, so Peter heads for a resort on Oahu where, as he's checking in, he sees Sarah and her new beau, Aldous, a polymorphously perverse English rocker(n)

Flashbacks chronicle the life of King David (DMX), who turns out to be more like Goliath when he is knifed by a gangster's young henchman (Michael Ealy). David Arquette costars as an aspiring writer, who inherits audiotapes that detail all of King David's nasty business dealings. Clifton Powell(n)

Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Who Killed the Candy Heiress? The Helen Brach Story
programme.desc: Who Killed the Candy Heiress? The Helen Brach Story. A troubled conman's past catches up to him in the A&E documentary American Justice: Who Killed the Candy Heiress -- Helen Bach. When millionairess Helen Brach disappeared in 1977, her absence wasn't noticed for two weeks. A fan of the horse races, Brach spent her time at the stables with her prize-winning breeds. The police were baffled by the case and came up with no suspects for 20 years. Then, in 1995, a list was compiled while working on the capture of an ill-willed ladies man named Richard Bailey which piqued the interest of detectives. Turns out Bailey was a costly habit for rich women. Prosecutors' suppositions were so strong that Bailey was convicted of the plot and sentenced to life in prison. Through interviews and footage, A&E reconstructs the case of the missing millionaire(n)

But DI Poole has several reasons to believe Valerie Dupree was murdered - not least the fact she poured herself a cup of the world's most expensive tea but only drank half. The pressure is on to find the culprit as the clinic is highly respected on the island and the chief surgeon is an old friend of Commissioner Patterson - and as the detectives begin to dig, they discover many sordid secrets among the guests and staff. programme.desc: Tension mounts when the gang attends a weekend science conference. Howard becomes argumentative after Bernadette runs into a former boyfriend, and the fallout causes chaos with the hotel room arrangements. Rick Fox guest stars, with Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon agrees to participate in a series of short lectures at the university, but is worried the students dislike him. programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The history of the prehistoric giants, using computer graphics and special effects to portray the Earth as scientists believe it was millions of years ago. The first episode looks at the rise of the earliest dinosaurs and their fight for domination.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: The life-cycle of a diplodocus in the Jurassic period 152 million years ago, when monster-like sauropods dominated the landscape of fern prairies and conifer forests before the advent of flowers, grass and birds. Computer graphics reconstruct the hatching of a young giant and the battle for survival in a world of carnivorous predators.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor heads to Japan, where he makes an early-morning trip to Tokyo's famous fish market, and heads out with a local fisherman to catch the highly poisonous fugu. He also visits the Kano river to try his hand at a regional sport, and the Ise-Shima National Park, where he freedives to the seabed to gather snails and sea urchins. Finally, he arrives at Mount Fuji, and endures poor weather to cast his line in Suruga Bay.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Series exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The programme also examines mankind's dependence on the elements, and how animals' lives are governed by the seasons, as a polar bear prepares its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.(n)

programme.title: Could We Survive a Mega-Tsunami
programme.desc: The destructive effects of tsunamis have been all too evident in recent years, with the one on Boxing Day 2004 killing around 250,000 people in southern Asia and another striking Japan in March 2011 - bringing one of the world's most advanced countries close to a nuclear catastrophe. This documentary uses the latest scientific modelling to present a minute-by-minute account of what might happen if there was a mega-tsunami in the Atlantic, and what it would do to cities including Casablanca, Lisbon, London and New York.(n)

programme.desc: The actor heads to Japan, where he makes an early-morning trip to Tokyo's famous fish market, and heads out with a local fisherman to catch the highly poisonous fugu. He also visits the Kano river to try his hand at a regional sport, and the Ise-Shima National Park, where he freedives to the seabed to gather snails and sea urchins. Finally, he arrives at Mount Fuji, and endures poor weather to cast his line in Suruga Bay.(n)

programme.title: Could We Survive a Mega-Tsunami
programme.desc: The destructive effects of tsunamis have been all too evident in recent years, with the one on Boxing Day 2004 killing around 250,000 people in southern Asia and another striking Japan in March 2011 - bringing one of the world's most advanced countries close to a nuclear catastrophe. This documentary uses the latest scientific modelling to present a minute-by-minute account of what might happen if there was a mega-tsunami in the Atlantic, and what it would do to cities including Casablanca, Lisbon, London and New York.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. Included are the epic journeys of sperm whales from one side of the ocean to the other in search of food and a mate, the thriving species that inhabit New Zealand's coast, and the tropical penguins and sea lions supported by the Galapagos Islands.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the lives and behaviour of the planet's fastest creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Water-dwelling giants of the late Jurassic period, when the Earth's coastlines were reshaped by a steady rise in sea levels and thousands of square miles of land were flooded. These shallow seas supported a revolution in marine life, and reptiles such as plesiosaurs shared the water with liopleurodon, the largest carnivore on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Flying reptiles from the early Cretaceous period, known as pterosaurs, which had small bodies and hollow bones, and flew by means of wings covered with a membrane. Most pterosaurs could stay airborne under their own power, but the largest ones, with a wingspan of up to 11 metres, probably relied on thermal currents.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor visits Panama, Central America, to begin the next leg of his adventure. There he teams up with a record-breaking angler to hook peacock bass at Lake Gatun. He also travels east to the Bayano River, where he hopes to encounter monster-sized tarpon renowned for their ferocity, and takes a trip to the Islas de las Perlas 30 miles off the Pacific coast. Finally, he sets out in search of huge billfish, but finds himself caught in an electrical storm.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: Planet Ice
programme.desc: Documentary taking a scientific tour of some of the most sensitive alpine glaciers, which are located at the foot of Mont Blanc, France.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teen fights to organise a high-school dance in a repressive town(n)

programme.title: The Night Before
programme.desc: Every Christmas Eve for the last decade, best friends Isaac (Seth Rogen), Ethan (Joseph Gordon-Levitt), and Chris (Anthony Mackie) have reunited for a wild night on the town in New York City. But since the guys are getting older and have to face new responsibilities, their tradition is about to come to an end. As a result, they plan one last epic night together, which includes finding their way to a legendary party called the Nutcracka Ball. Lizzy Caplan, Miley Cyrus, Mindy Kaling, Jillian Bell, and Michael Shannon co-star. Directed by Jonathan Levine(n)

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: Martin McDonagh's Oscar-nominated, BAFTA-winning Film4 debut film stars Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson as Ray and Ken, two professional Irish hitmen. After a botched job, they're sent by their boss Harry Waters to hide out in Bruges. Ken loves the city and its history; Ray hates it, until he hooks up with beautiful drugs dealer Chloe and a mouthy dwarf actor, Jimmy. Unfortunately, just as life seems to be improving for the two hitmen, psychopathic Harry phones to deliver stark instructions: the nature of the botched hit has offended his sense of morality and he's decided to break up the partnership, ordering one of the duo to kill the other. This tests the bond linking the three men, and leads to a violent denouement in the ancient city's cobbled streets(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: The mysterious fifth element when combined with four others creates the ultimate weapon against universal evil. The story begins in 1914 when benign aliens visit an ancient Egyptian temple to steal four stones containing information about this mysterious element. The visitors promise to return to Earth in the future to save it from evil. Three centuries pass and Earth is threatened by a thunderous Cosmic Evil. Unfortunately, the Evil killed the Good aliens who promised to save the planet. Fortunately, Earthlings have a piece of one of the alien saviors. Utilizing DNA restructuring, scientists grow the piece into a perfect new alien which takes the form of a curvaceous, seductive no-holds barred redheaded acrobat who escapes from the lab with the police in hot pursuit. Desperately she dives into a cab reluctantly driven by luckless former special force officer (Bruce Willis) who suddenly finds himself faced with the task of saving the universe by finding the missing stones and vanquishing the evil forces. Featuring dazzling special effects and classy production values coupled with a healthy splash of outlandish high fashion the emphasis of Besson's film is not so much plot as it is over-the top spectacle(n)

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: Ashley Judd is the woman set up for her husband's murder. In jail, she survives by clinging to the knowledge that she cannot be tried for the same crime twice. Revenge on her husband may yet be possible(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Robin Williams hit the box office jackpot as a dad passing himself off as a Scottish nanny to see his kids. Pierce Brosnan is his romantic rival in a great comedy(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teen fights to organise a high-school dance in a repressive town(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: Mel Brooks' classic sci-fi parody, starring Mel himself, Bill Pullman, Rick Moranis, John Candy and Joan Rivers. Packed full of more hilarious in-jokes than you can shake a lightsabre at(n)

programme.title: Obsessed
programme.desc: Enticement leads to terror when Lisa, a sexy office temp, forms a dangerous fixation on a successful and happily married asset manager named Derek. As her obsession progresses to stalking, Derek's idyllic marriage and promising career slowly disintegrate, until the once-happy couple and their newborn are forced into hiding as Lisa's wrath threatens to destroy them entirely(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: An Air Force pilot on a routine night mission, with his younger co-pilot, is a traitor who crashlands their Stealth Bomber in Death Valley so that he can steal the two nuclear warheads on-board and sell them to terrorists who plan to blackmail the Government(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof Monk
programme.desc: For 60 years, a mysterious nameless monk zigzagged the globe to protect an ancient scroll that grants remarkable powers to those who possess it. But now the monk must find someone new to assume the responsibility. As fate would have it, the new caretaker turns out to be a scruffy and distinctly non-enlightened petty thief named Kar. But when he inadvertently saves the Bulletproof Monk from capture, the two become partners in a scheme to save the world from the scroll's most avid pursuer. In the mission, they are aided by a beautiful Russian mob affiliate with amazing martial arts skills and a vested interest in keeping the scroll in virtuous hands(n)

programme.title: Spanglish
programme.desc: A Mexican immigrant working as a maid for an affluent Los Angeles couple has to maintain control of her own daughter, who wants to assimilate(n)

programme.title: Flyboys
programme.desc: The story of America's first fighter pilots, who joined France's Lafayette Escadrille before the U.S. became involved in World War I(n)

programme.title: The International
programme.desc: Action thriller concerning an ambitious Interpol agent who targets corruption at the top levels of the world's largest banking institutions. The world's most powerful banks have become hopelessly corrupt, prompting Interpol agent Louis Salinger and Manhattan assistant district attorney Eleanor Whitman follow a dangerous money trail from Berlin to Milan to New York and Istanbul(n)

programme.title: Broken Arrow

programme.title: Eddie Murphy: Raw
programme.desc: Outrageous comic Eddie Murphy makes a triumphant return to the stand-up comedy stage, sharing his unique, raunchy humour with his fans at its unexpurgated best(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof Monk
programme.desc: For 60 years, a mysterious nameless monk zigzagged the globe to protect an ancient scroll that grants remarkable powers to those who possess it. But now the monk must find someone new to assume the responsibility. As fate would have it, the new caretaker turns out to be a scruffy and distinctly non-enlightened petty thief named Kar. But when he inadvertently saves the Bulletproof Monk from capture, the two become partners in a scheme to save the world from the scroll's most avid pursuer. programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: Supposedly, when Sean Connery refused to star in another James Bond movie, producers Harry Saltzman and Albert Broccoli vowed to show up the insolent Connery by literally "creating" a new Bond from the ground up. That's why professional model and TV commercial-spokesman George Lazenby is cast as 007 in the 1969 filmization of Ian Fleming's 1963 Bond novel On Her Majesty's Secret Service. As a result, the film is one of the few in the series that could boast more than a passing resemblance to the Fleming original. This time around, Bond quits the secret service when he is told to end his obsessive search for master criminal Blofeld (Telly Savalas). While trailing his quarry in Portugal, Bond falls in love with Tracy Draco (Diana Rigg), daughter of a notorious gangster (Gabriele Ferzetti). The elder Draco agrees to help Bond find Blofeld, with the implicit understanding that Bond will marry Tracy. Bond's mission takes him to a Swiss mountain retreat, wherein Blofeld is executing his master plan of destroying the world's agricultural economy. When all is said and done, Bond does marry Tracy, but the honeymoon ends in sudden tragedy(n)

programme.title: GoldenEye
programme.desc: MI6 spy James Bond races to find a communications device that is being used by a madman to bring the world to its knees(n)

programme.title: Goldfinger
programme.desc: Beginning innocently enough with a murder, James Bond finds himself investigating Auric Goldfinger, a gold dealer who the Bank of England suspects is stockpiling huge amounts of gold bullion. However, he soon uncovers a far more sinister plot called Operation Grand Slam and has a fair bit of bowler-hat-dodging to do from Goldfinger's manservant, Oddjob(n)

programme.title: Licence to Kill
programme.desc: Shortly after an important drugs bust, CIA agent Felix Leighter is married, but when the drug lord he arrested escapes, kills his wife and mutilates Leighter his old friend British agent James Bond seeks revenge. When 'M' orders 007 to drop the matter and start a new assignment, Bond deserts Her Majesty's Secret Service and embarks on a world wide personal vendetta to kill those responsible(n)

programme.title: Highlander: Endgame
programme.desc: Connor McLeod and his kinsman Duncan are Immortals, members of a secret clan who can be killed only through decapitation. Connor and Duncan find themselves thrown into a tournament where Immortals, both good and evil, battle one another in a bid to become the last of their kind..(n)

programme.title: The Great Raid
programme.desc: One of the greatest rescue missions of all time gets an estimable treatment in this faithful, thrilling account of a daring operation to free more than 500 Allied POWs from their Japanese captors at Cabanatuan in the Philippines in 1945. Benjamin Bratt, James Franco, Joseph Fiennes, Connie Nielsen, Freddie Joe Farnsworth, Mark Consuelos, Natalie Mendoza, Robert Mammone, Max Martini(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: This program salutes the legendary filmmaker who, during World War II, ran the Field Photographic Branch, a unit that shot a raft of documentaries that captured "the scope and sprawl of World War II." Kris Kristofferson is the narrator. Included are comments by Hollywood directors Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich; and critics Leonard Maltin, Andrew Sarris and Richard Schickel(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: George C Scott rightly won the best actor Oscar (one of seven the film won) for his portrayal of General George Patton, one of America's greatest Wwii commanders, whose successes in North Africa, Italy and Europe were offset by his massive ego and maverick attitudes, including his infamous slap and dressing down of a battle-fatigued soldier that saw him lose his command in Italy. Directed by Franklin J Schaffner from Francis Ford Coppola and Edmund H North's screenplay(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: During WWII, two U.S. marines are assigned to protect Navajo radiomen, who encode military messages in their native language(n)

programme.desc: Chase thriller in which a wrongly imprisoned man manages to escape and heads for Mexico, with a ruthless sheriff in hot pursuit. This adaptation of James McLendon's novel featured the film debut of John Goodman(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to a Fashion Show.
programme.desc: A fashion designer commits murder, but unwittingly sows the seeds of his own downfall by hiring Natalie's 13-year-old daughter Julie as a model, thus ensuring his tell-tale guilty behaviour is closely observed by Monk. Guest starring Malcolm McDowell (Heroes).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lorelei Martins returns to avenge the death of her sister, convinced she has identified at least one of those responsible. She lies in wait at the home of a staff member of a shelter for battered women, eventually handcuffing her victim to a table and dispensing some savage justice. Thanks to the presence of a security camera, the team is soon after her, while Jane tries to exploit the situation to catch a bigger fish - Red John.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Jane investigate the murder of Corporal Lucy Green, who was a medic in an army hospital and spent a lot of time helping veterans who had post-traumatic stress disorder. Jane figures out a patient named Jacob made the emergency call, but he is suffering from severe amnesia and does not remember anything about that evening. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team is called in to assist with crowd control when a fire spreads through Griffith Park, but an investigation into the murder of a woman whose body is discovered in the chaos soon takes priority. Meanwhile, temporarily sharing an apartment with Fritz causes problems for Brenda. Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: When a murderer recently released from prison is killed in a hit-and-run, the team tries to determine whether the incident was intentional or a coincidence. Meanwhile, Brenda struggles in her personal life as she deals with an incapacitated Fritz. Guest starring Paul Michael Glaser.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo teams up with his girlfriend, ATF agent Zoe Keates, to investigate the circumstances surrounding the death of a US Marine in what initially seems like a simple road accident. The team reveals the dead man did indeed die due to a broken neck sustained during a crash, but someone shot at him first. As DiNozzo and Keates pursue their inquiry, they discover the victim's death is connected to a controversial ATF plan to place traceable firearms in the criminal system, and then follow them to the heads of crime organisations. Naval crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Marine visits the home of his former captain, only to find the man has been killed, and the killer is waiting inside the property. While the soldier escapes with his life, the attacker gets away too. It quickly emerges the prime suspect is Qasim, an Afghan translator evidence, and evidence points against him, until it is discovered he has a brother, who is loyal to the Taliban. The subsequent chain of evidence leads Gibbs and Bishop to Afghanistan.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: An actress is pushed to her death from a hotel balcony during a fundraising event for a local theatre production. Lisbon and the team learn that there is a long list of suspects, from the fading leading lady to the vindictive dancers in the supporting cast. Jane hopes Jason Lennon will emerge from his coma with information that will finally lead him to Red John.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the rest of the CBI team investigate when the owner of a dilapidated Wild West tourist town is murdered. Meanwhile, Kirkland is busy trying to find out how much Jane knows about Red John. Is the Homeland Security agent in league with the serial killer?.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A girl is found dead in suspicious circumstances and a well-connected classmate, previously accused of raping her, immediately catches Brenda's attention.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A reporter is the first person on the scene when a man wearing a surveillance wire in downtown Los Angeles is shot dead at point-blank range. As Brenda investigates the victim's connection to a drug ring, she and Fritz argue over who should take control of the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Naval intelligence ensign is killed in an unusual car accident. Gibbs and his team are reunited with old friend Ned Dorneget, who is now working with NCIS cyber operations, and NSA attorney Jake Malloy to investigate the case, and discover a conspiracy involving terrorist recruitment on the internet.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Special Agent Ned Dorneget of the NCIS cyber division joins the team to further their investigation into The Calling, the insidious terror network radicalising youngsters via the internet. When it emerges young suicide bomber Bradley was not, in fact, affiliated with The Calling, Gibbs and his colleagues realise they might be back to square-one. Determined to bring the organisation down, the agents pursue two new leads, an arms dealer who may be supplying The Calling with their signature German S-mines, and another boy given a deadly mission by the terrorists. Guest starring Matt Jones.(n)

programme.title: False Flag
programme.desc: New series. Five Israeli citizens' lives are turned upside down when they are implicated in the abduction of an Iranian politician. Thriller, starring Mickey Leon. In Hebrew.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agent Carter
programme.desc: Peggy must recover Howard Stark's deadliest weapon from enemy hands. But she needs to do so before SSR Chief Dooley and Agent Thompson discover her mission.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Ryan Reynolds becomes obsessed with Peter following the actor's unexpected arrival in Quahog, and Stewie lands himself in trouble when he takes the family car for a joyride.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Stewie travel back in time to January 1999 to witness the events of the pilot episode of Family Guy, Death Has a Shadow, and alter the course of history.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger enrols in a police academy after he and Francine fall victim to a mugger, hoping the course will help him learn how to defend himself. However, he falls under the influence of a corrupt cop (Bobby Cannavale). Meanwhile, Hayley's new friendship threatens her long-term relationship.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger kisses Francine in a drunken moment at a wine-tasting event, and when she decides to tell Stan about the incident, the panic-stricken alien tries to stop her. Meanwhile, Steve sets out to hone his skills at lucid dreaming, much to the amusement of Hayley and Klaus.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois fulfils a lifelong ambition by becoming a model, much to the displeasure of Peter and her father. Meanwhile, Brian works for Stewie's marketing company to pay for the treatment of an embarrassing problem.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Stewie use a hi-tech remote control to visit alternative realities, including a post-apocalyptic world run by dogs with humans as their pets and the Robot Chicken universe. Animation, featuring the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: Don't Look a Smith Horse in the Mouth.
programme.desc: Francine demands that Stan gives up his expensive SUV, so he buys a racehorse in a bid to win enough money to keep his petrol-guzzling car. Meanwhile, Steve enlists the aid of his friends to help an old acquaintance. Comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Wendy Schaal.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan complains that liberal social programmes are a waste of money and criticises Francine for helping at the local homeless shelter - until he develops a crack cocaine addiction and suddenly has a change of heart.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian turns to substance abuse to calm his nerves when a storm hits Quahog, but finds it difficult to sober up. Meanwhile, Meg plucks up the courage to take action after one too many insults from her family.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Screams of Silence: The Story of Brenda Q.
programme.desc: Quagmire is admitted to hospital following an accident, so his sister Brenda travels to Quahog to care for him with her boyfriend in tow - but he soon discovers she is the one who needs help.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine is swept off her feet by a romantic cyborg version of her husband who has come back from the future, and the encounter forces her to question her relationship with the real Stan. Meanwhile, Roger directs Steve and his friends in a remake of cult classic adventure movie The Goonies.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is initially impressed to discover Roger played in the 1980 US Olympic hockey team - but later finds that he took steroids to help improve his performance, and makes him give the medal back.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and the team investigate the mysterious death of a woman who received relationship advice from a radio-show host, and Rigsby and Van Pelt go undercover as a troubled couple in the hope of finding a lead. Crime drama, starring Owain Yeoman and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: When JJ LaRoche's house is robbed, he personally requests Jane's help with the case. The former head of CBI internal affairs tells Jane that one of the thieves got away with the secret plastic container he's kept hidden for nine years and begs him to solve the case before the contents are revealed and his life is destroyed. LaRoche suspects that the person responsible for high-level security leaks inside the agency is also behind the theft of the box. Guest starring Pruitt Taylor Vince, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Provenza and Flynn pose as hitmen to bring an attempted murder sting operation to a close, only to find all their evidence has been stolen while they stopped for lunch. Brenda is forced to free her suspect, and a furious Pope demands that Priory Homicide recover the missing items within 48 hours.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda struggles to decide how to handle the case of a missing boy - and as the investigation continues, suspicions arise as to whether he is a victim or a potential killer. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The death of Special Agent Ned Dorneget hits the team hard, and when Gibbs receives a visit from his late colleague's mother - CIA Officer Joanna Teague - he must decide whether to let her help with the investigation into the Calling. Meanwhile, Gibbs hopes his young charge Luke, formerly one of the Calling's radicalised footsoldiers, might be key to bringing the organisation down. However, when the terrorists discover where their defecting comrade has taken refuge, the abduct him and flee to Iraq. The team follows hot on their heels, but it seems Luke's ties to the Calling might be stronger than anyone at NCIS ever anticipated. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, with guest Mimi Rogers.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs fights for his life on board a US Navy hospital ship after being shot. Meanwhile, DiNozzo and Joanna Teague head for Shanghai, where they hope to take down the leaders of the terrorist group known as The Calling. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Mimi Rogers.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer the Heretic. It's a frosty Sunday morning in Springfield, and while Marge Simpson (voice of Julie Kavner) and her children, Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright), Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith), and Maggie, are getting ready to go to church, Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) just can't be bothered to get out of bed. Annoyed, Marge leaves without Homer, taking the kids with her. While his wife and children fidget through an especially tedious sermon and fight foul weather on the way home, Homer sleeps in, feasts on his "patented Space-Age Out-of-This-World Moon Waffles," and enjoys a football game on television. Convinced he's had the best Sunday morning of his life, Homer decides to renounce churchgoing, and in a dream God gives Homer the go-ahead to start his own faith. Marge is more than a bit taken aback by Homer's decision to renounce his faith, but nothing she says can dissuade him until Homer accidentally sets his house on fire while the rest of the family is at church. "Homer the Heretic" was first aired on October 8, 1992(n)

Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.(n)

Detective thriller based on Richard Price's novel, starring Tom Hardy, Gary Oldman and Noomi Rapace.(n)

Comedy thriller, with Brendan Gleeson, Don Cheadle and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.desc: After noticing discrepancies in sales, Allen, owner of ShoreFyre in Honolulu, contacts Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners Jordan and David go undercover and discover a related problem with the surf shop next door.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When Chef Chai, owner of his namesake restaurant in Honolulu, notices multiple ticket voids, he contacts Charles Stiles for help. Mystery Diners go undercover to see if his staff is making honest mistakes or committing foul play.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern discovers that America's Steel City, Pittsburgh, has a knack for blending old and new food traditions, from stuffed cabbage and braunschweiger, to goat heart tartare.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine and his team have visited over 100 locations to help failing restaurants. This edition features behind-the-scenes stories that make this impossible show possible.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team investigate rumours of a misbehaving restaurant mascot at Zippy's Giant Burgers in Seattle.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owners of a Seattle restaurant ask the team to investigate rumours that members of his staff are offering haunted tours of the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares grilled butterfly chicken, broccoli and tomato kebabs and a mixed berry pavlova.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten makes lemon fusilli with arugula and panacotta with balsamic strawberries.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten takes a trip to the harbour with her husband, then prepares Scallops Provencal.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten throws a thank-you lunch for the architects who helped build her new kitchen, with lobster paella on the menu.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef prepares potato dishes, including potato-wrapped chicken with pancetta and sage.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: For Anna, sometimes cooking is all about just feeling good; enjoy as she shares food lifts your spirits all day long. Anna likes to start with a yummy breakfast polenta with honeyed fruits.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Ezra and Julie throw out a life preserver to the Drag'n Angels. Can these delightful dragon boat racers win in the water and in the kitchen?.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares kicked-up spicy wings, make-ahead sandwich rolls, a potato skins bar and salted pretzel brownies for her football crazy sons and their friends.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Kitchen Confessional: Four Seasons On The Ranch.
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes red wine pot roast, chicken tacos with strawberry salsa, roasted beet and goat cheese salad, and carrot and squash curry soup.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond whips up chocolate treats, including white chocolate raspberry cheesecake, dipped and decorated waffle cones, milk chocolate mousse, and a chocolate orange martini.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a picnic for the younger kids, including animal crackers, cereal chicken fingers, cucumber finger sandwiches, salad on a stick, and mini watermelon wedges.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete to have their cake as the centrepiece of a party celebrating the 25th anniversary of iconic film Beauty and the Beast.(n)

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh learns how to make Chinese zong dumplings from her mother Christina, and finds out what it's like to work a shift in the kitchen of Andre Ursini's busy restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh and Jono choose a big range of plants at the nursery, meet an adventurous young chef and get some help from their friends and neighbour.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up more simple dishes using home-grown produce. He is joined by a Welsh sheep farmer who tackles common misconceptions about lamb and explains how the conditions the animals are kept in affects the quality of the meat.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The finalists prepare their seafood courses and those chefs who didn't make it onto the shortlist with their starters are hoping to do better this time. Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort are joined by D-Day veteran Ken Sturdy, who helped judge the North West heat. Who will be in with a chance of cooking their fish course at the St Paul's banquet?.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares recipes for four desserts, including a white chocolate pudding, a fast raspberry fool, a quick dessert panini, and caramel apple sauce to make a sundae.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Easter on the ranch starts with a Good Friday delivery of hot cross buns to friends. Ree makes tortellini primavera and 'krispy' eggs, with a basket of crudites and a spinach dip.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete to create a cake that will be the centrepiece of the lovable storybook bear Paddington's 90th anniversary party.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The young chefs face a serious seafood challenge and also have to create a healthy frozen dessert.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman searches for a hidden steakhouse serving up a veal chop speciality.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman samples more memorable cuisine, and begins his latest quest in Johannesburg, South Africa, where he samples a bacon-wrapped sandwich stuffed with cheese.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger visits New England for two unique food traditions that celebrate the community, including the Rotary Club of Essex in Connecticut that barbecues 300 pounds of fish.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: In Maine, a love of lobsters runs deep. Roger visits two places where piles of lobsters are cooked in the coolest wood-fired cookers.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a place cooking lamb in indoor smokers, an Italian deli making ravioli on a century-old machine, and a pizza oven in Hawaii creating island twists on meaty pies.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Toronto, Canada, to sample pork belly, a mac and cheese burger and a Christmas burger at a restored diner.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie swoops in to VB3 in Jersey City to help two cousins. Chef Mike runs the kitchen well but his cousin Joe is having difficulties managing the disorganised staff.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Lenny's Deli in Los Angeles asks Charles to investigate a baker who he fears is taking license with cake orders. Mystery Diners Kiel and Kendall go undercover and discover an even bigger problem in the deli.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Bryan, the owner of Corbin Bowling Center in Tarzana, California, contacts Charles for help with complaints about rowdy customers. Mystery Diners Eliot and Kendall go undercover and discover the staff is condoning reckless behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God

programme.title: Waiting for God

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Father's Day.
programme.desc: Convinced that Nelly is his mother, Hobbo sends Howard to eavesdrop on her and Pearl as he tries to find out more about his father. However, when the women concoct some false information, the police start to take an interest in the men's activities. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, June Whitfield and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers that an infirm friend needs help to bury his pet in the churchyard, and calls on Alvin and Entwistle to carry out the deed. However, the mission becomes complicated when the police begin to suspect the trio are up to no good. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Burt Kwouk and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Behind Every Bush There Is Not Necessarily a Howard.
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists his friends in a scheme to help Toby win back his ex-wife - but finds she only has eyes for Morton. Meanwhile, Howard tries to keep Pearl from interfering with his bike ride with Marina, and Cooper and Walsh test a new piece of in-car technology. Long-running rural comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Trevor Bannister, Peter Sallis and Burt Kwouk.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom is tempted to earn some extra money, but it is not to pay the bills or replenish his dwindling savings. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington. First broadcast in 1975.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom finds himself suffering a bad back during harvest time, which leaves Barbara to do all the work on her own - a situation made worse by the terrible weather. Sitcom, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A retired jeweller offers Del-Boy the deal of a lifetime - then suddenly has a heart attack and gets taken to hospital with a briefcase containing 250 cut-price gold necklaces still chained to his wrist. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: A chance encounter at the local garage with Kitchen Planet mogul Dan Moody results in Alan being asked to present the prestigious Norfolk Bravery Awards. With the event attracting many of the city's key figures, it could prove the perfect opportunity to elevate Alan into the social elite.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A hypnotist is booked to provide the entertainment at the triplets' baptism - and Agnes soon finds herself under his spell. Meanwhile, the matriarch's kitchen is falling apart - but that turns out to be the least of her problems when son Mark delivers some heartbreaking news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: Michael McIntyre showcases the comedy circuit's finest stand-up performers at the Waterfront Hall in Belfast, featuring sets by Patrick Kielty, Neil Delamere, Jeff Green and Kerry Godliman.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy organises Mark's stag weekend, which sees them set sail on a canal boat. The voyage seems to be a complete washout until a girl arrives to spice things up. Meanwhile, the groom-to-be gets offered an exciting job in India, providing a possible way out of his impending marriage to Sophie.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie and Eddie's TV is repossessed, giving them ample opportunity to amuse themselves with a series of violent tit-for-tat assaults thinly disguised as games. Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Miss Postern asks the other teachers to look after troubled pupil Josh, whose mother has gone off with a Masai tribesman. Before long, the boy is given a part in Greybridge's presentation of Romeo and Juliet in an attempt to take his mind off his problems. However, Mr Church has lost his job as theatre reviewer for the school magazine - and when Miss Postern takes his place, with Josh's father for company, the gormless science teacher is more than a little jealous. Classroom comedy, starring David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Vic and Bob present more offbeat humour in their various guises. Councillors Cox and Evans put forward another of their outlandish proposals, the Bra Men get up to a bit of jiggery-pokery and Sting is invited to chat with Donald and Davey Stott.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dafydd has a big decision to make - stay at home as the only gay in the village, or travel to London and risk becoming one of the crowd. Florence agonises over whether to hang up her crinolines, Linda receives hassle from the students, and Mrs Emery has knee trouble - causing a stomach-churning consultation for the doctor. Imelda Staunton guest stars in a Christmas special from 2005.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's brother outstays his welcome, and a leaking swimming pool causes problems for the planned gala. Chris Barrie and Harriet Thorpe star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Pearl throws Howard out of the house, prompting him to declare he has sworn off women for good - but Hobbo and friends take it upon themselves to get him to talk to Marina first. Meanwhile, Cooper and Walsh have their car valeted after receiving complaints from the sergeant, Glenda tries to whip herself and Barry into shape in time for Gloria's wedding, and Hobbo finds it difficult to avoid Miss Davenport's attentions at the library.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard).
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

Meanwhile, her romantic situation is just as messy as her professional life. Can she and Gary remain just good friends? Miranda Hart, Patricia Hodge and Tom Ellis star.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Childhood pals Edina and Patsy have a bitter bust-up and set out to find new best friends. Acclaimed comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, with guest appearances by Britt Ekland, Lulu and Zandra Rhodes.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin starts his job in Cardiff and, while Stacey is thrilled to be back in Wales, Smithy has to come to terms with living in Essex without his best friend. programme.title: The Squeeze
programme.desc: Terry Jastrow's The Squeeze centers on a gambler who takes a talented young golfer under his wing. Eventually, however, the stakes become greater than either of them ever imagined(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: This week's second heat sees six more chefs enter the kitchen, with Marcus's skills test challenging three of them to prepare scallops in three different ways, and Monica's testing the other three on their ability to make a sweet sabayon, served glazed with fruit. The remaining chefs then have the chance to showcase their style, technique and plating with their signature dish, aiming to prove to Gregg Wallace, Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti that they deserve a place in the quarter-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers head for Wales, where they meet three women who demonstrate their most impressive dishes, preparing Maltese stuffed marrow, an elaborate cheesecake, and an orchid gateaux. The pair also enjoy biker-cooked lamb cutlets en croute with a red wine gravy, and visit a recipe fair where budding cooks gather to share the best meals on their family menus.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Fantastical Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal brings back the wonder and excitement of childhood food memories and flavours on a monumental scale by super-sizing all manner of treats - from the world's biggest 99 Flake to a record-breaking bag of Hula Hoops - in a bid to reawaken the youngster in every viewer. He begins by tackling breakfast, using all his scientific skill to create the world's largest boiled egg and cereal on an epic scale - not forgetting the full English, which here includes metre-long sausages and jumbo baked beans. Adding to the fun, it's all served on Heston's own express train to busy commuters, those who usually don't have time to stop and eat in a morning.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates recipes inspired by classic British pub fare, beginning with dishes perfect for serving up to groups of friends. Tom shows how to prepare slow-cooked shoulder of lamb with pommes boulangere, and a salt beef bagel prompted by a trip to a stall at Maltby Street market in Bermondsey, south London. He also prepares pollack, chorizo and chickpea stew, and a creamy plum fool, as well as giving advice on how to source the best UK produce.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates how to recreate outdoor food at home, with recipes inspired by summers spent in beer gardens and cooking on the barbecue. He puts a southern-fried twist on the classic chicken in a basket he enjoyed as a teenager, heads to Cornwall to make a fish burger with freshly caught mackerel, pollack and lobster, and makes a maple cake baked on the barbecue.(n)
