programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd is off to Cornwall to visit a field kitchen at HMS Raleigh, the new-entry training establishment for all ratings joining the Royal Navy.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd prepares chicken with peppers and cream for the crew of a French trawler in Newlyn, Cornwall, and rustles up pork Normande for the owner of a pig farm. The chef also meets the man in charge of the Cornish Smoked Fish Co in Chatlestown.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John explores the inventive way Koreans use vegetables, eats a veg-heavy boribap lunch, and styles some mung bean pancakes in his Gangnam kitchen.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, in which the judges ask them to make a dessert of their own invention from a selection of ten ingredients, including whole almonds, apples, strawberries and mascarpone cheese. After two more chefs are sent home, the remaining contestants must prepare a two course menu of their own design for food critics Charles Campion, Tracey MacLeod and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers head for East Anglia, where they meet three women who provide examples of meals that have become family favourites. The pair also visit the coast to prepare sausage and bean casserole and jam roly-poly with custard, and a recipe fair highlights more home-cooked classics, including trifle, fruit cake and macaroni cheese.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Fantastical Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal recalls the 1970s heyday of the ice-cream van and tries to kick-start a revival of this ailing British tradition by planning to build the world's biggest 99 Flake - taller than five metres and weighing in at more than a ton. With Europe's largest ice-cream factory at his disposal, he begins production with help from some of the experts behind the 2012 Olympics, and plans to serve his creation from the back of a van in Gloucester.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates dishes inspired by food found on the menus of British pubs fit to celebrate special occasions. Tom shows how to cook the perfect slow roast duck, served with potato pancakes and braised lettuce, as well as spiced monkfish with smoked aubergine puree, and a gin and tonic granita for dessert. Later, he heads to Whitstable in Kent to whip up a seaweed mayonnaise to use as a dip for deep-fried oyster fritters.(n)

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Proper Pub Food
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef demonstrates dishes inspired by classics of the British pub menu. He begins by making a simple Caesar salad, before showing how easy it is to whip up bar snacks such as pickled eggs, spicy nuts and pork scratchings. As a twist on the traditional roast, Tom cooks pork belly, lentils and cabbage salsa, and heads to Suffolk to prepare his take on fish and chips with locally caught brill. He finishes off by preparing a date and toffee pudding with a caramelised banana topping.(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner (Nate Parker). Turner is ordered by his master (Armie Hammer) to tour a number of local plantations, delivering sermons to the other slaves that will urge them against violence and any thoughts of rebellion. However, he is so appalled and sickened by the horrors he sees during his travels that he is eventually moved to fight back against the evils of slavery. Aja Naomi King and Gabrielle Union co-star. Parker wrote, directed, and stars in The Birth of a Nation, which won the Grand Jury Prize at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.desc: A betrayed mob hit man goes the lam with his son, and seeks revenge against vicious gangsters. As the bullets start to fly, the impressionable child is exposed to the goriest aspects of his father's talents in this gorgeously stylized action thriller(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Based on the first volume in Philip Pullman's best-selling, award-winning trilogy, His Dark Materials, THE GOLDEN COMPASS unfolds an epic fantasy adventure set in a parallel world, where science and magic intertwine. Twelve-year-old Lyra Belacqua (played by newcomer Dakota Blue Richards) sets out to rescue her best friend, and ends up on an extraordinary quest to save not only her own world, but ours and others as well. Academy Award winner Nicole Kidman and stars with Daniel Craig in this triumph of the imagination. Filled with fascination, depth and wonder, Pullman's saga presents the eternal struggle of good vs. evil -- and the power of one young girl heal a rift torn in the fabric of the universe(n)

Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: The Fight Game With Jim Lampley
programme.desc: 06/14/2017. An interview with Sergey Kovalev; a breakdown of the Andre Ward-Kovalev rematch; a recap of Terence Crawford's New York fight; and a look back at the David Tua vs. Ike Ibeabuchi 1997 heavyweight bout(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Wonderfully rewarding urban fairy tale about a 12-year-old prodigy (the marvelous Freddie Highmore) who heads to New York City to find and reunite with the musician parents who abandoned him as a baby. Keri Russell and Jonathan Rhys Meyers costar as the young lovebirds who made sweet music (and a child) before their romance was dramatically and untimely cut short. Directed by Kirsten Sheridan. Robin Williams is a gas as a modern-day Fagin trying to "help" the lad in his quest(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: In this action-packed comic-book adventure set in the 1980s, the X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse. After the resurrected villain recruits four superpowered followers, Professor X and his charges attempt to stop them(n)

programme.title: Marley & Me
programme.desc: The Devil Wears Prada director David Frankel's light comedy-drama - based on a best-selling autobiography - stars Owen Wilson and Jennifer Aniston as a pair of married journalists who welcome a truly unruly dog into their lives. Relocating to Florida, newlyweds John and Jenny Grogan end up working for rival newspapers, and it's soon obvious that Jenny has landed the more high-profile job. But when she starts to become broody, one of John's colleagues suggests they see how they cope with a puppy before trying for a baby. John duly picks a cute yellow Labrador Retriever as a gift for his spouse. It's quickly clear their acquisition is something of a double-edged sword: he's an untrainably anarchic source of destruction; but he also gives John the material for a wry newspaper column, which greatly increases his standing.The film follows the trajectory of the Grogans' marriage, through good times and bad, and the stuff of everyday life, with the dog providing comic relief and the leads turning in convincing, heart-warming performances(n)

programme.desc: A lonely writer begins a relationship with his hyper- intelligent computer operating system(n)

programme.desc: Crime drama about a veteran LAPD detective who journeys to a small Alaskan town with his partner to investigate the murder of a 17-year-old girl. Evidence mounts up against a reclusive novelist, but the investigation is hampered by the region's perpetual daylight, which wreaks sleep-depriving havoc on the detective's body clock and threatens his judgement(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: William Munny, a notorious killer, has settled down on a farm with his two children. His animals are sick and times are hard. When he finds out that there is $500 to be made from killing two cowboys, who deserve it, he reluctantly takes it on. He calls on his old partner Ned, who rides with him and 'The Schofield Kid', the young boy who told Munny about the money. They enter the town which is watched over by an evil sheriff called Little Bill(n)

programme.title: Necessary Roughness
programme.desc: After sacking their old team, Texas State University hire a coach to assemble a new football team. The motley crew he collects includes a retired high-school football star, a military fanatic, a physics teacher and, as place kicker, a dishy female. Overcoming all obstacles on and off the field, they attempt to win the championship(n)

programme.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
programme.desc: Dave Attell. Dave Attell performs a set from San Francisco. Among other things, he talks about trash trucks, cable TV, and when men know they're going bald ("your conversations with your barber keep getting shorter")(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: The Friendly Ghost attempts to befriend the 12-year-old daughter of a paranormal expert, but his nasty ghost uncles wreak havoc(n)

programme.title: Grumpier Old Men
programme.desc: Summertime has come to Wabasha, Minnesota, and mosquito-slapping in canoes has replaced shivering in ice shanties as the local fishing ritual. Even the decades-old battle of one-upmanship between next-door neighbours John Gustafson and Max Goldman has mellowed. With John happily and newly married to Ariel, Max is left without a sparring partner(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Zany horror spoof about a talented brain surgeon trapped in marriage to a malicious wife whose affections are shared with everyone but her husband. A serial elevator killer is on the loose, and the good doctor finds himself in love with the disembodied brain of one of the killer's victims. All he needs is a body to put it in(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: A couple decide to let fate determine if they are meant for each other(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after an incident at a fashionable event causes them to be hounded by the paparazzi(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: Sparks fly between a female TV news channel boss and two male reporters (William Hurt and Albert Brooks) in this 1988 comedy(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A mild-mannered accountant runs into an old high-school classmate, an overweight loser-turned-muscular CIA agent, and ends up helping him with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites in this outrageous action comedy(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. This raucous comedy-drama is based on true events(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after an incident at a fashionable event causes them to be hounded by the paparazzi(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: In this romantic comedy, the proud Portokalos clan reels from the news that their thirtysomething daughter has fallen for a teacher who is not Greek(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Adam Sandler plays Satan's bumbling, slack-jawed spawn in this devilish, effects-laden comedy. Nicky (Sandler) rises from the fiery depths of hell and enters New York City, where he tries to save the world and his father's life by battling his two supremely evil brothers, who are scheming to upset the balance of good and evil. Patricia Arquette, Harvey Keitel, Rodney Dangerfield(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two unruly brothers (Zac Efron and Adam DeVine) are forced to find dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii by their parents, who hope that a couple of nice gals will keep their wild behavior under control. However, a pair of hard-partying ladies (Anna Kendrick and Aubrey Plaza) see a viral video in which they plead for dates, and decide to pretend to be the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip. Directed by Jake Szymanski(n)

programme.title: Protocol
programme.desc: A bubbly cocktail waitress goes to Washington and stirs up the US State Department(n)

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: The lives of a kooky collection of Miami residents interconnect in this adaptation of humorist Dave Barry's novel. A high-school boy accidentally crosses paths with two hitmen hunting a crooked businessman. Chaos ensues as the boy, the hitmen, two confused cops, two petty robbers, and the Russian mob all get tangled up with one another(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Remake of the richard donner film from john Moore (A Good Day to Die Hard) with Julia Stiles, Liev Schreiber, and Mia Farrow (Rosemary's Baby)(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a chauvinistic advertising executive who acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking, attempting to use this power to bring about the fall of his female boss. But as he uses this inside knowledge to outwit his superior, the bachelor begins to fall in love with her, and so finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks like it may come to fruition. But as he uses this inside knowledge to outwit his superior, the bachelor begins to fall in love with her, and so finds himself feeling more than a little guilty when his plan to have her sacked looks like it may come to fruition(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube and Chris Tucker (star of the Rush Hour movies) are two LA guys hanging out on a Friday - Ice Cube's just been fired from his job but Tucker has a more serious concern - he smoked rather than sold the $200 stash of dope he got from Faizon Love. Now the two have a choice - find the money by the end of the day or enter a whole world of pain in F Gary Gray's black comedy(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: In 1925, an enterprising pro football player convinces America's too-good-to-be-true college football hero to play for his team and keep the league from going under(n)

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: A bumbling oddball working as a National Gallery security guard is sent to LA in a cynical plot by his superiors to get rid of him, but his trip across the Pond causes mayhem(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: When it comes to dating, Christina Walters has a golden rule: avoid searching for Mr. Right and focus on Mr. Right Now. That is until one night at a club when she unexpectedly meets Peter, only to see him suddenly disappear the next day. She and her best friend Courtney decide to break the rules and go on a road trip to find him, encountering numerous misadventures along the way(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: Brendan Fraser stars in this 'fish out of water' comedy. A young man struggles to come to terms with the modern world after emerging from a bunker where he's lived since 1962(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube and Chris Tucker (star of the Rush Hour movies) are two LA guys hanging out on a Friday - Ice Cube's just been fired from his job but Tucker has a more serious concern - he smoked rather than sold the $200 stash of dope he got from Faizon Love. Now the two have a choice - find the money by the end of the day or enter a whole world of pain in F Gary Gray's black comedy(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: In this sequel to Friday, Ice Cube returns as the streetwise LA dude who grassed up a local gangster. Who's now out and on his trail. This would be a good time to chill out in the suburbs with cousin Mike Epps and uncle Don 'Dc' Curry, who happens to have won the lottery but, as he finds out, money can't buy you love or security in Steve Carr's smart comedy(n)

programme.title: Welcome Home Roscoe Jenkins
programme.desc: A single father who has just found success as the host of an outrageous television talk show begins to question his path in life when he returns home to attend his parents' 50th wedding anniversary party in the company of his famous fiancée -- a reality television star -- in this crisis-of-conscience comedy starring Martin Lawrence. RJ Stevens (Lawrence) is a television talk-show sensation who has transcended his modest Southern beginnings to become the most popular self-help guru ever to grace the small screen. His show, "Team of Me," is a ratings juggernaut, his fiancée is a beautiful reality television star, and his pockets are always lined with large bills. There are few Tinseltown dreams that RJ hasn't already achieved, so when his parents announce their 50th wedding anniversary, the family-oriented television star immediately drops everything and sets his sights on Georgia. As a boy, RJ was always the target of ridicule within his family, but these days things are different; not only does RJ have a ten-year-old son, but his bride-to-be is admired by countless viewers all across the globe on a weekly basis. But RJ's egotistical West Coast attitude simply doesn't fly in the South, and when his lovable but relentless family refuses to cut him any slack due to his current superstar status, he must finally pause and take stock of the man he has become. Louis C.K., Cedric the Entertainer, Michael Clarke Duncan, and James Earl Jones co-star in a Southern-flavored family comedy written and directed by Malcolm D. Lee(n)

programme.title: Making of 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2'
programme.desc: A look at "My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2," a 2016 sequel to the 2002 hit that follows the Portokalos clan as they celebrate another momentous walk down the aisle. The film stars Nia Vardalos, John Corbett, Lainie Kazan and Michael Constantine, and is directed by Kirk Jones(n)

programme.title: Camp Nowhere
programme.desc: "Mud" Himmel is a nerd. Once again he is faced with attending computer camp. His buddy Zack will be marching into go to military camp while Trish is acting happy about theater camp. That Gaby is going again to fat camp weighs heavily upon her mind. None of them are thrilled with their camp prospects and it is rebellious Mud who suggest that they create their own, secret camp(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy Dog
programme.desc: An unexpected transformation helps a workaholic attorney learn that there's more to life than the courtroom in this remake of the 1959 Disney canine classic of the same name. Deputy District Attorney Dave Douglas (Tim Allen) takes his job in the halls of justice very seriously -- so seriously in fact that his wife and family see considerably less of their frequently-absent husband and father than they would prefer. When a case involving an animal laboratory finds the distracted dad once again taking an extended leave of absence from his frustrated family, Douglas' luck takes a turn for the worst after he is inadvertently infected by a top-secret genetic-mutation serum that transforms the two-legged lawyer into a four-legged sheepdog. Though his current situation has its drawbacks to be sure, the fly-on-the-wall perspective afforded to Douglas in his newfound state alerts the well-intending father and husband that all is not well on the home front. Moved by the unfulfilled needs of his neglected family and determined to become a better father if he can only shed his winter coat, Douglas' unique new vantage point could offer just the motivation needed to bring the nefarious forces behind the serum to justice and win back his wife and kids once and for all(n)

programme.title: Inkheart

programme.desc: Deran Sarafian's all-action film stars Charlie Sheen as Richard 'Ditch' Brodie, a skydiving instructor. He's approached by a new pupil, Chris Morrow but while he takes his eye off her, she makes an unscheduled jump which ends in tragedy. Facing a manslaughter charge, Brodie starts his own investigations only to find himself caught up in a conspiracy involving stolen gold, the Russian mafia and enough bullets and explosions to last him a lifetime(n)

programme.title: Babylon A.D.

programme.title: Biker Boyz
programme.desc: Two generations of radical bikers face off in this rubber-burning action drama. Manuel "Smoke" Galloway (Laurence Fishburne) is the leader of the Black Knights, an underground motorcycle club. Smoke, like most of his fellow Knights, is a successful white collar worker who can afford fancy leathers and top quality bikes, and Smoke has earned a reputation as the "King of Cali," willing take on anyone in a drag race, legal or no. Kid (Derek Luke) is a gifted young rider whose father was once Smoke's mechanic; when Kid's dad died after an accident, Kid set out to become the best biker he could be to carry on his father's name and reputation. Smoke, however, has no room in the Black Knights for Kid, and so he and several fellow outcast riders start their own club, the Biker Boyz, and challenge Smoke to prove once and for all who is the fastest rider on the scene. Biker Boyz also features appearances from Orlando Jones, Lisa Bonet, Djimon Hounsou, Larenz Tate, and Kid Rock(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: John Farley (Sean William Scott) has overcome years of childhood and teenage humiliation and has fashioned himself into a self-help author who guides others towards releasing their painful memories and rebuilding their self-esteem. However, his miserable past sneaks up on him when he returns to his hometown only to find that his mother is marrying Mr. Woodcock (Billy Bob Thornton), the tough gym teacher who was the source of his school years' woes. Determined to stop his mother from marrying the man who made school a living hell for him, John is going to need all the self-help he can get. The cast of this outrageous comedy is rounded up by Susan Sarandon, Amy Poehler and Ethan Suplee(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: When Preston Blake, a remarkably wealthy media magnate, dies with neither a wife nor children, the question on the lips of most of his associates is who will inherit the estate. The surprising answer turns out to be Longfellow Deeds (Adam Sandler), a cheerful but half-bright proprietor of a small-town pizzeria, as well as part-time greeting card poet, who was a distant relative of Blake(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys

Enjoying a sedentary life of bowling and Bob Dylan the eponymous hero finds himself surrounded by nihilists, henchmen and performance artists when he is paid to deliver the ransom for the kidnapped wife of a conservative businessman, also called Lebowski(n)

programme.title: The Boss

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Losing his inheritance to the autistic brother he never knew he had, Charlie Babbitt tracks down his savant sibling and takes him on a road trip; his mercenary motives giving way to a profound new understanding of the brilliant yet troubled Raymond(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: The Four Horsemen return to clear their names with one last spectacular stunt and at the same time expose the unethical practices of a tech mogul(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: A psychologist is sent to investigate strange events on a space station orbiting the planet Prometheus. With the planet seemingly able to take over astronauts' minds, the shrink is shocked to encounter his late wife. Sci-fi mystery(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this captivating sci-fi adventure, Roy rescues his son Alton from a cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper, the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: A look at the dangerous world of camel racing; a report on the debate over Native American mascots; and a study of the injury rate among cheerleaders. Correspondents include Bernard Goldberg and Frank Deford(n)

programme.title: American Psycho
programme.desc: Graphic violence and dark comedy color this adaptation of Bret Easton Ellis's controversial novel. A hotshot broker (Christian Bale) basks in the excesses of his late-1980s yuppie lifestyle, but behind his slick appearance lurks a soulless killer who's cutting a murderous swath through New York City. Contains footage not shown in theaters. Jared Leto, Willem Dafoe, Chloe Sevigny, Reese Witherspoon(n)

programme.title: American Psycho II: All American Girl
programme.desc: Set after Patrick Bateman's horrific murder spree in American Psycho, American Psycho 2 is the story of Rachael Newman a survivor of Bateman's original atrocities. Her run in with Patrick has left her with an unwholesome taste for violence and it is only a matter of time before this bubbles to the surface. When Rachael enrols at the university department for Behavioural and Social Sciences, under the expert leadership of ex-FBI man Robert Starkman, she is determined to rise to the top - by whatever means necessary(n)

programme.title: The Kid Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: Robert Evans' rise from second-string actor (who really was discovered while lounging by the pool at the Beverly Hills Hotel) to head of one of Hollywood's biggest movie studios is told from the viewpoint of Evans himself in this documentary, adapted from his autobiography (and featuring Evans' own narration). In 1957, Evans had already achieved success in the garment business when actress Norma Shearer spotting him at poolside and suggested he should play her late husband, legendary producer Irving Thalberg, in the movie Man of a Thousand Faces. While Evans knew he wasn't cut out to be an actor, he discovered he liked the movie business, and after becoming a film industry executive, Evans was named head of production at Paramount in the late '60s. Under Evans' leadership, Paramount produced such classics as Rosemary's Baby, Love Story, and The Godfather. He also married actress Ali McGraw; however, McGraw left Evans for Steve McQueen after they starred together in The Getaway. After leaving Paramount to become a producer (and racking up hits like Chinatown and Marathon Man), Evans' golden touch began to elude him; an arrest for drugs seemed to put an end to his career, until he made a comeback as a freelance producer in the 1990s on such films as Sliver and The Saint. Part of the narration for The Kid Stays in the Picture was drawn from the book-on-tape version of Robert Evans' autobiography of the same name, which featured Evans reading his own work; the audio book has developed a cult following of its own, and legend has it Dustin Hoffman based his performance in Wag The Dog on Evans' reading style on the tape(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Yuppie Daniel Miller is killed in a car accident and goes to Judgement City, a waiting room for the after life. During the day, he must prove in courtroom-style process that he led a successful life(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: A bride-to-be (Amanda Seyfried) in Greece attempts to solve the mystery of her paternity by reading her mother's (Meryl Streep) diary. Pierce Brosnan, Stellan Skarsgard and Colin Firth are the likeliest suspects. Based on the popular ABBA-inspired stage musical. Christine Baranaski, Julie Walters, Dominic Cooper(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg is the worldly singer thrust into a convent for safety by police after she sees her boyfriend shot by a mobster. Although she's not a natural nun, she soon befriends the sisters, takes them out on the town and teaches them to sing, soul-style. Lots of fun, most stemming from the big-hearted Goldberg(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Coal Miner's Slaughter. A pre-Will and Grace Megan Mullally guest stars in this episode as Molly Connors, the feisty daughter of West Virginia coal miner Eben Connors (Denver Pyle). When Eben dies in a suspicious mining accident, Molly sweeps into town to accuse the mine's owner of being responsible for her dad's death. Shortly thereafter, the owner is found murdered--and the murder weapon, a rifle, is located in Molly's car. All that is preventing Molly from being torn to pieces by the hostile local citizens is the presence of the girl's former creative-writing teacher Jessica Fletcher (Angela Lansbury), who as usual suspects that someone else has perpetrated the foul deed(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr. Monk Goes to the Dentist
programme.desc: Mr. Monk Goes to the Dentist. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote: South by Southwest
programme.desc: Three years after the cancellation of her popular series Murder She Wrote, Angela Lansbury returns for the first of several TV-movie followups to that selfsame series. Once again, Lansbury is cast as Jessica Fletcher, best-selling mystery writer and amateur sleuth. As indicated by the film's title, Hitchcock references abound in the plotline, beginning when a lady vanishes on the train that Jessica is taking to El Paso to deliver a lecture. Helpful Jessica accepts a message for the mystery woman, whereupon she is attacked by an assailant in search of "it." Our heroine is rescued by a journalist who may not be a journalist, then when attempting to ascertain the missing woman's whereabouts Jessica is warned to mind her own business by a guy identifying himself as an FBI agent. Inasmuch as such warnings have never stopped Jessica in the past, she follows the trail of clues to the desert town of Agua Verde, Arizona, adopting a few aliases alng the way. The climax is an echo of Hitch's The 39 Steps, wherein Jessica not only solves the mystery but also unmasks the Least Likely Suspect (or in this case, Least Likely Suspects). Produced and directed by Angela Lansbury's sons, Murder She Wrote: South by Southwest first aired November 2, 1997 on CBS(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: New series. The return of the quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round of each episode, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.(n)

programme.desc: Rebecca encourages Robert to try and save his relationship as Aaron returns to the village - but he is told that it is too late. Lawrence is unnerved as he realises Lachlan may have taken the situation with Tim into his own hands.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle gets very close to nature as he takes a chilly naked dip in one of Snowdonia's hidden lakes. Liz Bonnin heads the Dark Skies Park in Galloway, where she hopes to inspire a group of inner city youngsters with a nocturnal safari. Plus, the programme meets Yorkshire Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen and her family as they welcome baby number nine into the flock.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Robert's horrified to see that Michelle's car has been vandalised, Erica flirts with Zeedan, and Aidan watches jealously as Maria enjoys a date with Will in the Rovers. Meanwhile, as Summer cries for her dad, Todd and Billy wish they could fix things for her.(n)

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Another selection of clips showcasing what can go wrong on holiday, including an unexpected visitor to a couple's tent on their safari holiday, footage from a GoPro camera lost at sea, and a man who took a flight to the edge of space.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Busiest Motorway
programme.desc: Documentary, charting the work of the men and women who toil behind the scenes on the M25, one of the busiest motorways in Britain. The series begins as traffic officers Simon and Gary deal with a four-car pile-up blocking two lanes. Delays mean the recovery trucks are late arriving on the scene, and as tensions rise, the officers face an uncomfortable wait. Meanwhile, the Northern Control Room, operator Emily is under pressure as rush-hour heats up, and maintenance workers Jack and Jamie face the unenviable task of clearing a layby of rubbish - and human waste - left behind by lorry drivers.(n)

programme.title: Sugar Free Farm
programme.desc: Seven celebrities submit to a diet free from sugar, refined carbs, processed fats and cheap meat. From the moment they take up residence in a farmworkers' cottage, they're put to work to earn all the healthy food they eat. TV presenter Alison Hammond cooks from scratch with natural ingredients, comedian Joe Pasquale discovers an aptitude for pig husbandry, and ex MP Ann Widdecombe overcomes an aversion to whole grains. However, while Peter Davison, Stavros Flatley are also put through their paces, reality star Gemma Collins has trouble handling the farm work.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. The victim was a leading light in the village - an amateur astronomer who was passionate about preserving Moonstone Ridge, a Bronze Age heritage site housing a 1930s observatory. Barnaby and Jones are called in to investigate, and the duo discover that intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the local stargazing community. Murder mystery, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Kenny Ireland, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Martin Clunes: Islands of Australia
programme.desc: With more than 8,000 islands to choose from, Martin Clunes visits 16 which provide an insight into the diversity, history and challenges of island life in Australia. His first stop is Lord Howe Island, where the pace of life is slow and the population is a steady 350. He also visits Norfolk Island, Australia's most easterly territory, and the remotest island on Martin's journey.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men

The third instalment in the comedy series, with Jason Biggs, Alyson Hannigan, Seann William Scott, Eddie Kaye Thomas and Eugene Levy.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy

programme.title: Wild at Heart

However, Du Plessis grows suspicious and fears the newcomer has an ulterior motive. Meanwhile, Fatani struggles while helping Liv and Thabo with the animal census.(n)

programme.desc: Brooks agrees to help old friend and partner Jimmy Valentine with an undercover drug sting, but when the bust goes wrong and a dealer ends up dead, suspicion falls on the officers. As Devlin pushes for the truth, the spotlight turns on Brooks' dark past, and a 10-year-old case involving no witnesses and a large quantity of missing heroin. Guest starring Hustle's Robert Glenister, former Rising Damp star Don Warrington and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral), alongside Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: The Street
programme.desc: New resident Paul Billerton, who works as a gardener in the local parks, takes a shine to local girl Kirsty. One morning he plucks up the courage to ask her on a date and an awkward relationship begins. However, Paul confides in Kirsty he is carrying a terrible secret he cannot share, which eventually leads him to the brink of self-destruction. With Robyn Addison and Jodhi May. programme.title: Mrs Biggs
programme.desc: Ronnie takes part in the Great Train Robbery and returns home to a horrified Charmian. She is aware of the magnitude of the crime and knows the stability of their family has been jeopardised for ever - and this proves to be the case when he is arrested and sentenced to 30 years in prison. Disowned by her loved ones, Charmian must navigate her way through an extortion attempt while facing up to the prospect of raising their children alone. Drama, starring Sheridan Smith and Daniel Mays.(n)

programme.title: Million Dollar Princesses

Snubbed by New York's old-money families, these ambitious new millionaires, along with their daughters, set their sights on England, where they quickly gained entry into the highest levels of the British aristocracy.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Animal Orphans
programme.desc: The comedian visits an animal rehabilitation centre in Pretoria, where he bottle-feeds a giraffe calf that was abandoned by its parents hours after its birth. He then meets a warthog in Durban that is about to be released into the wild, before feeding and preening a chick at a vulture conservation project near Johannesburg. Finally, Paul heads to Kafue National Park in Zambia to see where the elephants end up after they leave the nursery. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programme.desc: Griff Rhys Jones returns to showcase another selection of hilarious film and TV outtakes rescued from the cutting-room. Among the stars whose gaffes are highlighted in this edition are Elton John, David Beckham and Ricky Gervais, and fumbled takes from the sets of Coronation Street, Mr Selfridge and EastEnders also make an appearance. Plus, mistakes from The One Show demonstrate the perils of live TV, and Jeremy Kyle has a painful encounter with a stray camera.(n)

programme.desc: Two children go on trial for killing a toddler, each blaming the other, and the case hinges on whether forensic evidence can prove who is guilty of strangling the boy to death. CPS director George Castle defies his superiors and takes instruction from the victim's mother, who has a surprising point of view on the crime. Drama, guest starring Deborah Findlay (Cranford), with Bill Paterson.(n)

programme.title: Lewis

Lewis and Hathaway discover he had been imprisoned for trying to kill well-known atheist Tom Rattan and had only recently been released. The inspector soon has reason to believe the Rattan family is hiding something from him - but nothing prepares him for the evidence Dr Hobson uncovers at the post-mortem. programme.title: Live Pre-Season Football
programme.sub-title: Football: Audi Cup Live: Atletico Madrid v Napoli.
programme.desc: Atletico Madrid v Napoli (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the opening semi-final of the two-day pre-season tournament, which takes place at Allianz Arena in Munich. The Spanish outfit will expect to be much sharper than their Italian opponents in this contest, owing to the fact the La Liga season begins two weeks earlier than Serie A, so they should be much further along in their preparations. Presented by Jacqui Oatley, with analysis from Robbie Fowler and Paul Ince.(n)

programme.title: Live Pre-Season Football
programme.sub-title: Football: Audi Cup Live: Bayern Munich v Liverpool.
programme.desc: Bayern Munich v Liverpool (Kick-off 7.30pm). Coverage of the second semi-final of the two-day pre-season tournament, which takes place at Allianz Arena in Munich. Having already participated in the Premier League Asia Trophy in Hong Kong, the Reds continue their preparations for the new campaign with this friendly tournament in Germany, and face a tough challenge this evening against the Bundesliga champions. Presented by Jacqui Oatley, with analysis from Robbie Fowler and Paul Ince.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 4
programme.desc: Mismatched LAPD detectives Riggs and Murtaugh stumble across a ship transporting Chinese immigrants into the US. programme.title: Outside Edge

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Richard and Hazel open their doors to Belgian refugees while they await news of James, but a language barrier develops and the servants are unimpressed by the guests' ideas of cleanliness.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A man caught transporting illegal immigrants panics and holds staff hostage in a bid to avoid any police involvement. Jack takes control of the situation, proving there's more to him than meets the eye, while Andrew is emotionally scarred by the experience. Elsewhere, Sam and Mike make no attempt to deny they're an item when everyone finds out they're sharing a flat. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An adoption file goes missing after a break-in at the council offices and a toddler is abducted shortly afterwards.(n)

programme.title: Island at War
programme.desc: Drama series set amid the German occupation of the fictional Channel Island of St Gregory in 1940. News of the imminent invasion reaches the islanders, who rush to prepare for the arrival. Policeman Wilf Jonas and his wife Kathleen decide to send their children to England, but son Colin has other ideas, while grocer Urban Mahy is left a photography shop by a fleeing Jewish neighbour and immediately rushes down to the harbour to catch all of the action on camera - with tragic consequences. Starring James Wilby, Clare Holman, Philip Glenister and Saskia Reeves.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A single mother from Sunderland asks Kavanagh to prosecute the neighbourhood vigilante she suspects of attempting to murder her teenage tearaway son in a hit-and-run incident. At first he has misgivings about accepting a case so far from home, but finally agrees, only to find his already strained family life suffering as a result. Tense legal drama, starring John Thaw and Lisa Harrow, with a guest appearance by Robert Glenister.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is assaulted, and is shocked by the reaction of the Aidensfield residents when suspicion falls on a local policeman - until the attacker strikes again. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James ruins his chances of gaining a medal by telling dinner party guests about the Army running out of ammunition at the front. Meanwhile, Edward returns from fighting and finds a very receptive Daisy waiting for him.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Stuart has a lot of explaining to do when a medical procedure goes badly wrong, and Jack is quick to use the blunder as an example of Robert's lack of leadership. Meanwhile, Judy learns her father's cancer has returned, and Andrew remains traumatised by recent events, causing him to shirk his responsibilities. Sam and Mike revel in the fact that they're hospital gossip. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Poirot visits a garden fete where he meets the son of an old friend and his fiancee. After having tea with the couple, the sleuth suspects that they are both in danger and Hastings' new interest in photography provides him with the clue to solve a mystery involving cyanide, failing brakes and mixed-up love lives.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is reunited with old friend Ariadne Oliver, who has been commissioned to stage a game of murder hunt at a summer fete in the grounds of Nasse House, the recently purchased home of wealthy financier Sir George Stubbs. However, the novelist's instincts tell her she's getting involved in something much darker - and she's proved right when the girl volunteering to play the part of the victim really does turn out to be dead. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Zoe Wanamaker, Sean Pertwee, Martin Jarvis, Sam Kelly, Sinead Cusack, Rosalind Ayres and Tom Ellis.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.desc: A secret brings Elizabeth and Paige together, while Oleg comes under KGB suspicion in Moscow. A new twist in the Morozov operation creates an opportunity that changes everything.(n)

programme.title: Prime Suspect 1973
programme.desc: Bradfield sees a chance to get revenge on Clifford and diverts the team to carry out surveillance on the Bentleys - and when Tennison learns of the operation, she is forced to make a split-second decision as to what is most important, her career or her family? As Bradfield uncovers more details about the heist, he faces the disapproval of his colleagues as he becomes determined to catch them in the act.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: New series. The detectives investigate two murders in which the victims have been placed in water and surrounded by flowers. Vera and sidekick Joe believe the culprit may be linked to a group of bird-watching friends, but despite their increasingly tangled and dysfunctional relationships, the twitchers seem determined to protect one another. Drama adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Hidden Depths, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Gina McKee, Wunmi Mosaku, Paul Ritter and Neil Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The detectives investigate a case of criminal damage and threatening behaviour between two brothers, leading to the fatal poisoning of a family dog. When the officers identify the toxin as medication prescribed to one of the siblings, they discover someone has been collecting and using the drugs illegally. Ben Hull and Jane Antrobus star.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The detectives investigate a case of aggravated burglary and assault that has left the victim, Joseph, unconscious in hospital. Discovered by his best friend and tenant Andrea Marshall, who had recently been in Australia and claims to be clueless as to why he was even in her flat, Joseph is soon suspected of using the place as a love nest to carry out an affair. Drama filmed in the format of a documentary, guest starring Siobhan Hayes (My Family), Rupert Hill (Coronation Street) and Michelle Gayle (EastEnders).(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James ruins his chances of gaining a medal by telling dinner party guests about the Army running out of ammunition at the front. Meanwhile, Edward returns from fighting and finds a very receptive Daisy waiting for him.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Stuart has a lot of explaining to do when a medical procedure goes badly wrong, and Jack is quick to use the blunder as an example of Robert's lack of leadership. Meanwhile, Judy learns her father's cancer has returned, and Andrew remains traumatised by recent events, causing him to shirk his responsibilities. Sam and Mike revel in the fact that they're hospital gossip. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Detectives Preston and Shaw investigate the case of a woman who awakes to discover she has been attacked on a night out but has no memory of the violent encounter. Under the assumption that she has been drugged, the detectives call in her colleagues for questioning but when a picture of the victim is uploaded online, they are not sure that she is as innocent as she claims.(n)

programme.title: Dandelion Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama set in the 1920s, starring Michael Kitchen as a downtrodden, henpecked solicitor who buys a quantity of arsenic to kill the dandelions on his lawn, and suddenly realises it could be used to solve the problem of his wife as well. With Sarah Miles and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James ruins his chances of gaining a medal by telling dinner party guests about the Army running out of ammunition at the front. Meanwhile, Edward returns from fighting and finds a very receptive Daisy waiting for him.(n)

Robert turns a blind eye when Mike carries out a procedure which goes against protocol, and Jack is hurt that Christine won't move in with him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina is assaulted, and is shocked by the reaction of the Aidensfield residents when suspicion falls on a local policeman - until the attacker strikes again. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.desc: James and Felicity's son Philip is sent back to the island on a secret mission for the British Army, but when he and his comrade Eugene are left without an escape route, they are forced to hide from the Germans in the loft of the Jonases' farmhouse. Meanwhile, the islanders re-open their businesses for the first time since the invasion but Cassie struggles to cope with serving the enemy. Baron von Rheingarten is given a tour of the island and stuns James by deciding to move into the Dorr family home. James Wilby, Sam Heughan and Philip Glenister star.(n)

programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick investigates the sudden reappearance of a local man last seen seven years previously, who turns up out of the blue and claims to be suffering from amnesia. programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs

The public are in panic after the shocking death of Russian grandmaster Ivan Savaranoff during a game of chess. Poirot must try to determine the good guys from the bad, as a complex plot by a gang of dangerous dissidents sees a host of international figures used like pawns. David Suchet stars in a story adapted by Mark Gatiss and Ian Hallard.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Judgment Day Approaches. It's the first week back, and news quickly spreads that Abby's court sentencing is just two weeks away. programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: With their two daughters ready to leave home, adventurous Preston couple Geoff and Sally Taylor are looking to wind down and spend more quality time together. They fell in love with Costa Rica when they visited it on holiday and have decided to buy a holiday home on its Pacific Coast, so Ben Hillman shows the duo five properties in the region within their £300,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Jacqueline Priddin's parents moved to the Costa del Sol, she and husband Anthony have dreamt of also buying a place there for them and their daughter Izzy. Now they have decided to make that happen, so Ben Hillman shows them five homes in the inland area west of Malaga that suit their £50,000 budget. But will it be a town house or a rustic finca that wins them over?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, where owner Alan Johnson and his professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to win the title - but a scandal with some unwanted hair on the bed sheets is not a good start, and two guests feel they are making an exhibition of themselves with a tea-trolley in full view of the neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the second day of the competition, the contestants visit the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, and owners Nick and Gina Mead hope to impress them with an afternoon of entertainment out on the locks. At breakfast, one of the guests admits to not enjoying his stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes that his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition. He is in his element making saucy jokes during an afternoon of sausage making, but his reluctance to stray from the menu at breakfast leaves some of his guests disappointed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Heyford House in Oxfordshire, where Leo and Sonya Brooke-Little hope to impress the contestants with their hospitality. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock Burgius sees as the perfect opportunity to settle some scores with his fellow competitors.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's winner is announced as the B&B owners meet for the last time to thrash out their differences. Feedback includes criticism of a badly positioned tea tray, controversy over a hot chocolate and accusations of overenthusiastic hosting.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Amanda and Adam Cropper find a new home in the Thai province of Phuket, which they intend to use as a holiday home before they eventually move there permanently.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former How Clean is Your House? presenter Kim Woodburn and her husband Pete decide they would like to take ownership of a holiday home on the glamourous Costa Del Sol, so Jonnie Irwin takes them to view five penthouses that meet their £200,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Horse-owners Stephen and Stephanie Fry believe an 11th-century flour mill once stood on their land, and ask the experts to search for evidence. Mick Aston soon finds ample clues such as the remnants of millstreams used to power grindstones that suggest their theory is correct, but a problem arises when one of their finds does not fit in with the story.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Jersey, where they search for the origins of Mont Orgueil Castle, an imposing fortress constructed during the reign of King John. Their excavation is complicated by a newer castle that was built on top of the old foundations in Tudor times - and the entire site is located on a rocky outcrop with sides so steep they can only be scaled by mountaineers.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: New series. A 21-year-old cat needs to have a huge mass removed from its ear, but any general anaesthetic at this age is a big risk, while Scott Miller is concerned about the liver of a Chihuahua suffering from diabetes.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke delves into the world of small builds, meeting people taking tiny, unpromising spaces and creating places to live, work and play. In the first episode, he meets a couple who have invested their savings to convert a wreck of a bus into a holiday let, sees how an old underground toilet has been turned into an apartment and finds how a horsebox has been given a new lease of life as a holiday home. George's own project of making over a dilapidated caravan gets off to a shaky start as his builder fails to see the potential in a hulk of rusting metal from the 1970s.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets a master craftsman whose dream is to build a castle in rural Devon made entirely of mud. Kevin McCabe plans to form the huge property out of two vast curved roundhouses - the largest of which is inspired by the natural geometry of a snail shell - connected by glazing and topped with wildflower meadow roofs to mirror the surrounding countryside. However, the project involves mixing and laying a mind-boggling 2,000 tons of cob, all during warm, sunny weather - and the sheer scale of the task soon becomes clear.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: New series. Scientists who are experts in natural disasters examine the most extreme catastrophes to have hit the Earth, beginning with the most devastating volcanic eruptions.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Niki, 34, is airlifted to St George's after crashing into another rider during a charity bike ride between London and Brighton. While staff try to contact Niki's wife Phill, who is almost 300 miles away at their home in the north east of England, 90-year-old Peter is rushed to A&E with severe blood poisoning.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Schoolboy Eddie, 12, is brought into A&E having been hit by a car on his way home from school, and doctors are concerned he may have suffered a bleed on the brain, as well as damage to his kidneys. Meanwhile, 64-year-old Linda, who breathes with the help of a tracheostomy, arrives at King's after experiencing respiratory failure at home, and student Amy, 20, has been coughing up blood.(n)

programme.title: Volatile Earth
programme.desc: New series. Scientists who are experts in natural disasters examine the most extreme catastrophes to have hit the Earth, beginning with the most devastating volcanic eruptions.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Niki, 34, is airlifted to St George's after crashing into another rider during a charity bike ride between London and Brighton. While staff try to contact Niki's wife Phill, who is almost 300 miles away at their home in the north east of England, 90-year-old Peter is rushed to A&E with severe blood poisoning.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save - Handlebar, Casa Roma and the Black Pearl - to find out whether his advice has been put to good use.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Jack Osbourne, Uri Geller, Tim Minchin and Holly Walsh join regular team captains Sean Lock and Jason Manford to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Amanda and Adam Cropper find a new home in the Thai province of Phuket, which they intend to use as a holiday home before they eventually move there permanently.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Former How Clean is Your House? presenter Kim Woodburn and her husband Pete decide they would like to take ownership of a holiday home on the glamourous Costa Del Sol, so Jonnie Irwin takes them to view five penthouses that meet their £200,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Pauline Cox's Wharfe House in Wetherby, West Yorkshire, and a visit to a local vineyard sees a clash between guest Mike Hepker and Tash Thorne.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit Wortwell Hall Barn in Norfolk, run by husband-and-wife duo Clive and Jenny Aylett, but when the pair's rivals arrive, Pauline Cox and Claire Smith have difficulty locating their favourite appliance. Publicans Mike Pearce and Tash Thorne are astonished to discover they cannot lock their room's door. In the morning, some of the guest make awkward requests to change their breakfast orders, causing professional chef Clive to experience a meltdown in the kitchen that leads to a fundamental error.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Bath Lodge Castle in Somerset for the third day of the competition, where they are wowed by Karen and Mike Hepker's luxury castle experience. Although the guests are disappointed at the bathroom fixtures and fittings, they are given the chance to vent their emotions during an afternoon of painting in the castle grounds. Plus, tensions rise between Mike and Tash at dinner, and harsh comments at feedback lead the hosts to suspect game playing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to The Old Lodge Hotel in Gosport, Hampshire, run by publicans Mike Pearce and Tash Thorne. Karen Hepker is disappointed with the honeymoon suite, while Clive and Jenny Aylett find a dubious looking splash guard in the shower. A boat tour backfires when Jenny struggles with her water phobia and at dinner Karen takes the opportunity to tell the others exactly what she thinks of them. But things really kick off when it comes to feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wharfe House hosts Pauline Cox and Claire Smith begin a bitter debate, demanding to know why their beds caused such a sleepless night. Accusations subsequently fly in all directions and walk-outs look on the cards as tensions mount leading to the payments being revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Laura Hamilton helps a family hunt for an ideal holiday home near Torrevieja on Spain's southern Costa Blanca. The end of the Spanish property boom raises hopes that the Framptons' budget of £150,000 will stretch farther than expected.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Christine Vaughan, who is looking for a holiday home in Barbados on a budget of £150,000 and also wants to generate income by renting out the property. However, the Caribbean island's sunny weather leaves Christine struggling to focus on business.(n)

programme.title: Time Team Specials
programme.sub-title: Wars of the Roses: A Time Team Special.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Leicestershire to examine archaeological discoveries at the site of the Battle of Bosworth Field, a confrontation that took place in 1485 and led to Henry Tudor taking the English Crown. Artefacts are unearthed that challenge the traditional interpretation of events, and Tony hears from experts who believe that not only were gunpowder weapons used in far greater numbers than previously thought, but also that the encounter was fought in a different place.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Nether Poppleton, Yorkshire: The Monastery and the Mansion.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Nether Poppleton near York in a bid to find out more about the village's origins. Residents are recruited to join in the excavations as the experts try to establish whether the settlement, mentioned in the Domesday Book as the land of St Everilda, dates back to the Anglo-Saxons.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Charismatic Australian vet Dr Scott Miller attends to the needs of more animals in his surgery in south-west London. A beagle puppy that has been left with a punctured eyeball and sliced lens seeks treatment, while vet Jo and nurse Gemma take a pregnant stray cat to foster carer Penny.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect continues his exploration of the world of small builds, meeting a man planning a bolt-hole in the Lake District, and visiting a community in Hackney, east London, in which people live and work in customised shipping containers. He also travels to a home in nearby Shoreditch where the kitchen has been moved onto the roof, and finds out how an Oxford resident has turned his back garden into a party palace using a caravan.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows a project to renovate and extend a classic 1920s cinema in Thorne, South Yorkshire. With little knowledge of restoration, Gwyn and Kate boldly set about turning the dilapidated building into a family home using masses of concrete after taking advice from an architect friend. The couple are hoping to create a hydraulic glass wall that opens up one side of the house to form a UV-filtered canopy, and there are also plans for a white roof extension that resembles a diving board.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In Grasmere, chef Kevin Tickle goes foraging to cook some local dishes at his Forest Side restaurant, and in Wensleydale, gamekeeper David Hutchinson readies the estate for a shoot.(n)

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to two restaurants - Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea - to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress? Plus, an update on Finn McCool's from season one.(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: The Wedding. In the first episode of a two-part story, the wedding of Jesse (John Stamos) and Becky (Lisa Loughlin) is only a few hours away when Becky's dad (Don Hood) lectures Jesse on the grim responsibilites of matrimony. Faced with the prospect of giving up his wild-and-crazy lifestyle, Jesse decides to take one last fling--and a mighty dangerous one at that. Elsewhere, Michelle (played by the Olsen twins) takes an instant dislike to Becky's nephew Howie (Michael John Nunes)(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: The Wedding. In the conclusion of a two-part story, everybody has gathered together for Jesse's wedding--everybody, that is, except Jesse (John Stamos). Having decided to take one last fling before tying the knot with Becky (Lisa Loughlin), Jesse had gone skydiving, and as a result is now stuck in a rural jail. Upon learning of her future husband's fate, Becky rushes off to bail him out--and now we face the prospect of a wedding ceremony minus both bride and groom(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: Observational documentary revealing the inner workings of the central London thoroughfare, following police and paramedics as they work to keep the public safe. In the first episode, a shopper is badly injured in a fall on a Tube escalator, and cameras accompany service teams into the district's sewers.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Adventures Aftershock
programme.desc: Zak Bagans interviews former Ghost Adventures participants to find out how their lives have changed since his investigations of the Exorcist House and the Ohio State Reformatory were completed. Both his guests strongly believe that their attachment to demonic spirits has led to strokes and heart attacks.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted
programme.desc: Yvette Fielding and her fearless squad visit Ripon Workhouse in North Yorkshire, a venue said to be teeming with undead souls - one of which seems to be following them around.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore land in Nottinghamshire, and houses in Kent and Devon.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.desc: Investigators capture the face of a small child who drowned, and a man reveals footage of an paranormal animal in his home.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Adventures
programme.desc: Ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin visit Hotel Metlen in Dillon, Montana. Built in 1897 the historic building has numerous stories of hauntings and strange activity. The third floor, closed to the public for 20 years, is where the strangest events have been heard and felt, and the crew gains access to this closed-off part of the building to find out if the tales are true.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion set off on a trip around Britain seeking out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction. They begin their journey in Whaley Bridge, Derbyshire, before heading to an auction in Liverpool.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the series in which enthusiastic home cooks take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. The first stop on their nationwide tour is the Cotswolds, where judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood challenge them to make their signature cakes and tackle a recipe for Victoria sponge. The week's final task sees them producing a tricky chocolate celebration cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.desc: The broadcaster reports from Coalinga State Hospital in California, home to more than 500 sex offenders, many of whom have already served lengthy prison sentences and are deemed unsafe for release. During his visit, Louis finds out about a therapy programme run by psychologists who hope to rehabilitate willing participants - but many inmates refuse to take part, with only 13 having completed the course since it began.(n)

programme.title: Nurses Who Kill

She was convicted of murdering four children, attempting to murder three other children, and causing grievous bodily harm to a further six, receiving 13 life sentences for the crimes in 1993.(n)

programme.desc: Joanna Dennehy, who lured two of her three male victims to their death with the promise of sex, and whose spree ended with two knife attacks in broad daylight.(n)

programme.desc: Years of pent-up grief bubble to the surface when Barry encounters Reverse Flash, aka Professor Zoom, the man who killed his mother. Superhero adventure, starring Grant Gustin.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: The superhero adventure returns after its mid-season break. Chilly super-villain Captain Cold is back in Central City - and he has company in the shape of Heat Wave. Together, this evil pairing have set their sights on stealing a multimillion dollar painting - can the super-fast hero possibly win against the forces of fire and ice? He has his reservations, especially after what happened during his last face-off with his old friend - but when a loved one is kidnapped, he quickly races to the rescue. Grant Gustin stars, with guest appearances by former Prison Break actors Wentworth Miller and Dominic Purcell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)
